loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 38 years old. He is married with two children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use in maize production.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 54 años de edad, está en unión de hecho, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad; el vive junto a su familia en el Departamento de Sololá.
Comenta que actualmente tiene un negocio de compraventa de verduras; la verdura la compra por cuerda (0.0715 hectáreas) posteriormente la comercializa por quintales y esto lo hace el mercado de Sololá. Realiza esta actividad porque le genera ingresos  inmediatos para cubrir los gastos familiares. Tiene 15 años de estar realizando esta labor y cuenta que se siente muy feliz de estar haciéndolo
.Además de esta actividad también se dedica a la agricultura, y los ingresos de esta actividad complementan su presupuesto familiar.
Es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de una cuerda de cebolla.
Su mayor sueño es adquirir más terrenos para cultivar.
texts.en: Julio, 54, is in a common-law marriage, has a three-year-old son, and lives with his family in the department of Sololá. He says that he buys and sells vegetables. He pays per cord (0.0715 hectares) for the vegetables and later sells them by the quintal in the Sololá market. He has been operating his business for 15 years to generate cash to pay household expenses and says he is happy with his work. He also farms, and that income supplements the family budget. So Julio has applied for a loan of Q 6000 to buy a cord of onions. His biggest dream is to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy a cord of onions.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 36 years old, is from Nyahururu, where he is married to Zipporah and the father of three children aged 16, 11 and 2 years old. He has been running his hardware business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

Samuel has applied for his second loan of KES. 20,924 which will be used for pay school fees for his child who is in high school. In the future, he hopes to educate his children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To pay school fees for one of his children

loans.name: Lorena Isabel

texts.es: Lorena Guerrero es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Se dedica a la elaboración y producción de repostería, el cual lo ha mantenido de forma creciente. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que el financiamiento le ayudo a incrementar la elaboración de sus productos. Solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de: Harina, Huevos, Azúcar, Polvo para hornear entre otros, con el fin de aumentar la producción de su repostería. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá cumplir con los pedidos y demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en: Lorena Guerrero lives in Granada and makes and sells pastries and her business is growing.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because the loan helped her increase her production.  She is asking for a new loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, powdered sugar, and other things so she can increase her production.  She estimates that this loan will be helpful and that she will be able to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Yesu Adom Group

texts.en:
Yesu Adom Group consists of 4 members, all women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. 

Princilla is a 45-year-old woman living with her husband and her four children, who attend school. Her husband works as a plumber in a factory situated in Accra. Princilla runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent and drinks in her shop. Princilla has developed a very good relationship with her customers in her community. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her community. 

Princilla has a plan to make her shop bigger and to keep multiple items in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items in bulk directly from the wholesalers. She has requested a loan for purchasing items such as rice, grains, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent and drinks so that she can serve her customers better.

Princilla and her colleagues need a total amount of GHS 4,500 to increase their stock.

loans.use: to purchase items such as rice, grains, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent and drinks

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 37-year-old married woman, who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for producing milk and selling it to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profit. 

Naseem has become famous for providing good quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her fourth loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow.

 Naseem is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that he can prepare breakfast for his children and save money to buy mosquito nets

loans.name: Aziz Unisa

texts.en: Aziz Unisa is 31 years old. Three years ago, she began stitching work in her house to contribute to the family income. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She has therefore applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy more spools of threads, packs of laces, zippers and laces in various colors to create a means of increasing revenues to generate a healthier source of income. Aziz Unisa is in her 5th loan cycle, with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more thread, laces and zippers

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been running a business selling blankets, spreads and bed covers for the past six years. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers. She has become famous for selling good material in her community and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Sharifan has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stocks of blankets and spreads in different designs and colors from the wholesale market. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of blankets and spreads in different designs and colors.

loans.name: Imrana

texts.en: Imrana, 31 years old, is the mother of six children. She has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner. With the passage of time, Imrana's sales increased, along with her income. She now has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. Imrana helps her husband in all family and financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. Imrana is in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good credit history. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 44-year-old married lady, and she has been running a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and has many regular customers who shop at her store. 

She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is 42-years-old and a married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Robina’s husband who is a driver by profession that provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for eight years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Robina has applied for a loan of RS 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Robina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to help her husband buy new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (mother and father). 

She sells second hand clothes at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this  business for 10 years. She works six days a week.   She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to educating her children up to university level.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of  used clothes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 33 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Patrick and they are blessed with three children aged eight, five and three years old. She has been running her business of selling firewood and cereals to her neighbors for the last eight years. To enable her to buy more stocks of firewood and cereals, she has applied for her third loan of KES 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Right now Agnes's monthly income is KES 15,000. She intends to use her profits to educate her children. In the future, Agnes hopes to buy a plot of land and construct some rental houses for extra income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood and cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 30's, is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been running two business,  food shop and a clothing shop, since 1999.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to buy good stock for both of her shops.  She dreams of buying her products from abroad.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group, "ZAWADI," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  buy good stock for both of her shops.

loans.name: Manuel Alfonso

texts.es: Manuel tiene 24 años de edad y reside en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 7 meses de edad. Manuel es un joven emprendedor, responsable y dedicado. Él trabaja en una fábrica cercana a su localidad y de ahí saca el ingreso que le permite mantener la economía de su hogar. Con el fin de dar mayor seguridad a su familia desea terminar  su humilde vivienda ya que no ha logrado terminarla por falta de recursos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, grava, arena y hierro. Ya cuenta con el ladrillo que utilizará por lo que no invertirá en esto. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Manuel, 24, lives in his own house with his life partner and their 7-month-old son. Manuel is enterprising, responsible, and determined. His job at a local factory provides enough income to support his family. He wants to finish building his modest home so that his family will be safer, but he lacks the money to do so. He has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, gravel, sand, and iron. He already has bricks and doesn't need to buy more. He says he can make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, and iron to finish his house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 60 years old from Olkalou. She is widowed and is blessed with three children who are all independent adults. She has been running her business of selling second-hand clothes for the last thirteen years. To enable her to buy more stocks of these clothes, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Grace's monthly income right now is KES 10,000. She intends to use the anticipated profit from her expanded business to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya and to start another business. In the future, Grace hopes to be an established clothes seller in her area.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of second-hand clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 49-year-old lady and the mother of four children. She has been in the business of manufacturing footballs for the past 15 years. Her husband is a laborer, and does not earn enough income to cover their household expenditures alone. She makes footballs in different sizes, and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs, and earns enough to pay the expenses of her family members. 
 
Rehana is responsible providing her family with good quality food, health care and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees).  She intends to use this loan to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers along with spools of thread in large quantities.  

She is hoping to expand her business, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers along with spools of thread in large quantities.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran, 38 years old, is married and she works from home as a tailor. She has been in this business for two years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Bashiran was not earning an income, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family, so Bashiran felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. 

Bashiran's hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stocks of threads in different colors, packs of buttons, needles and laces in order to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her three children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, buttons, needles and laces.

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en:
Yanti runs a small stall, which sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits and processes bill payments. Yanti lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area three hours from Jakarta. Yanti is married and has children.

Yanti began working with Ruma three months ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last three months, she has had around $40 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is a 27-year-old vigorous woman who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. Due to lack of availability of funds, Kiran is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She has therefore requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons to allow her to stitch up more dresses in less time. Kiran is in her 8th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more thread, laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 31-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shabana’s husband, a driver by profession, who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but it now requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

Shabana has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 for her husband to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shabana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Sunshine Stars Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 30-year-old Florence, a member of Sunshine Stars Group, from Mutare. She is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. Florence also cares for one other dependent. For the past 4 years, Florence has run a retail business selling televisions, dvds, beds and clothes. She says the main challenges faced are high custom duties at border posts and high transportation costs. 

Florence has requested a loan of $400 to purchase television sets, dvds, beds and clothing for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Florence plans to own her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy television sets, DVDs, beds and clothing for resale in Mutare

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so Rozina initiated her business selling cosmetics and artificial jewelry to the people of her community. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality products in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Rozina has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase jewelry stock, such as earrings, bracelets and rings in various colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately generate more income for her. Rozina is in her 4th loan cycle, with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry stock, such as earrings, bracelets and rings in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: Shama is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last seven years. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband is a driver by profession and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items such as grains, salts and sugar, in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education, health, and food, and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items such as grains, salts and sugar.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 30-year-old, married woman. She is running a small beauty parlor for the people of her community. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and she makes enough money to contribute to the family's income. 

Salma needs to deal with more customers all the time. For this, she requires in large quantities, hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening, so she applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 through Kashf Foundation.  

Salma is in her fifth loan cycle, with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction, as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy in large quantities, hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Muamet

texts.en:
Muamet is a first time client of VisionFund Albania. He has been producing and selling fresh produce for the past 10 years. 

Here is what he said during his interview with the loan officer.  “I enjoy agriculture, and enjoy selling as well. During these past years of being in this kind of activity, I have established a good clientele. I believe that I have served them well. I produce in large quantities, and sell in the supermarkets of my nearby town.” 

Muamet is determined to continue growing the business, and for this, he needs your help to invest in agricultural land.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: Suta Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
3 months before the date of repayment, it’s the rainy season. Plant growth is very good and it brings joy to the farmer. Likewise with Suta Pertiwi group, the rainy season brings maximum results for their garden. Chili, beans, cucumbers, watermelons and other crops provide maximum results, and they can sell these at a price that is satisfactory. They are very happy with the results obtained. As the heads of their families, members of the Suta Pertiwi group are able to meet the needs of the family and save for their children's school fees.

Wayan sold all their crops in the market and obtained satisfactory results. His income grew. Because it is still the rainy season, he and all members of the group decided to continue the loan at MUK and it will be used to buy fertilizer, for plant maintenance costs, and to buy various types of seeds. They hope the weather will still continue to support the process of planting in the garden so that maximum results can be achieved.

One member couldn't attend the meeting because he must attend a religious ceremony. Wayan is in the right of the front row wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, for plant maintenance costs and to buy various types of seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chains, purses, bracelets and makeup for resale.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Джумагул добродушная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она имеет троих детей, но с мужем давно рассталась и ей приходится самостоятельно растить своих детей. Родилась и живёт по сей день в маленьком кишлаке. Джумагул работает медсестрой в местной больнице. Там она получает хороший одной заработной платы медсестры не хватает на расходы семьи, так как  она мать одиночка.
И вот женщина мать решила дополнительный источник дохода, и свой выбор она решила открыть точку (продовольствие) магазин.  Для этого ей не хватала денежных средств. Не имея нужной сумму она обратилось  в нашу организацию и рассказывает, что после начиная сотрудничество с нашей организации её жизнь изменилась на лучшее стороны. А теперь она хочет сделать  ремонт своего  дома и обратилось к нам. И Джумагул выражает свою благодарность в МДО Арванд за финансовою поддержку и такую возможность и доверие.
texts.en: Jumagul is a good natured and hardworking woman. She has three children, but her husband is left long ago and she has to raise her children alone. She was born and lives to this day in a small village. Jumagul works as a nurse at a local hospital. There she has one good nurses' pay, but it is not enough to raise her family, as she is a single mother. Here's a woman and mother who decided to supplement her income and she chose to open a food trading store. She did not have enough funding for this. Not having the right amount of funds, she asked our organization and said, that after she began to work together with our organization her life changed for the better. Now she wants to renovate her house and is asking us. Jumagul expresses her gratitude for MDO Arvand for financial support and the opportunity and trust.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rubber bowls, buckets, and baskets for resale.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 19-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is a teacher who has been working in this domain since a year ago. She receives her students at her house, where she has prepared a special room to educate them properly. 

Marwa is very ambitious, and her only aim is to teach students well in order to achieve higher educational levels in their lives. Therefore, they will engage in good jobs from which they can earn a good income to live in proper conditions. 

Today, Marwa seeks to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase teaching supplies, such as books, stationery and other items needed. 

Marwa is in need to improve her income, since she helps her family who suffer from a bad financial situation in paying the heavy life expenses.

loans.use: to purchase teaching supplies such as books, stationery and other items needed.

loans.name: Tanzania Group

texts.en:
Halima is in her mid 30's. She is married and has one son, who is still at school. For the past 6 years, Halima has been running two business, selling charcoal and cold drinks. She works from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Halima's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock in both businesses. Halima is doing very well and is happy with the loan. She has repaid all her loans successfully. Halima used her profit to pay school fees, to buy a fridge and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and cold drinks to resell. Halima dreams of building her own house.

Halima will share this loan with her group "Tanzania", which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and cold drinks to resell.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 39 лет. Она образованная и умная женщина. Благодаря своим родителям, она получила медицинское образование. Мухайё более 19 лет работает в медицинском учреждении медсестрой. Мухайё является одной из лучших работников. Она имеет большой опыт. Мухайё замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 не совершеннолетних детей. Она должна провести церемонию обрезания своего сына, но не имеет денег. Мухайё запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для проведения церемония обрезания своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhayo is a happy woman.  She is 39 years old.  She is an educated and smart woman.  Thanks to her parents, she obtained medical education.  Muhayo has been working as a nurse at medical facility for over 19 years.  Muhayo is one of the best employees.  She has a lot of experience.  Muhayo is married and raising 5 adolescent children.  She has to hold a circumcision ceremony for her son, but does not have money.  Muhayo is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to hold the circumcision ceremony for her son.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a circumcision ceremony for her son

loans.name: 3.03.806.08.thiệu Lý Group

texts.en:
Yến works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.  Yến is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 3.03.806.08.Thiệu Lý solidarity group, which consists of 9 members.  Yến lives with 2 dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Yến joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid 4 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Yến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Yến hopes for her business to do well and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rumba

texts.en:
This is Rumba. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to purchase more stock for his business. He would like to apply for a loan of KES 40,000 to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, salt, sugar, cooking oil and maize flour for his business. 

Rumba's profits from business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, salt, sugar, cooking oil and maize flour for his business.

loans.name: Majani

texts.en: Majani appreciates the previous loan that improved his living standards. His previous loan enabled him to expand his retail shop business and earn a higher income. Besides the retail shop business, Majani operates a motorbike. He would like to apply for a loan of KES 80,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorbike and to add more household items to his business. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike and add more household items to his business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives at his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and he dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of KES 50,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en:
Sanh, 65 years old, is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. He and his wife support the family through the income they earn from their general store. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Sanh started this shop 30 years ago. He sells sugar, toys for children, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business to prepare selling goods during the Vietnamese New Year by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages.

The additional capital will enable him to increase his sales and he hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products such as food and beverages for selling during holiday seasons.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long, 48 years old, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. He and his wife support their family through the income they earn from their general store. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. He started this business 24 years ago.

He sells sugar, toys for children, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages.

The additional capital will enable him to increase his sales and he hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him  to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of products such as food and beverages to stock his store.

loans.name: Trung

texts.en:
Trung, 36 years old, is married and has a daughter. He and his wife support their family with the income they earn from their sewing shop. They began this business six years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying some sewing machines to increase  production of sewing products.

The additional capital will enable him to increase his sales.  He hopes his business runs smoothly, and that this will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en:
Xuyen, 41 years old, is married and has three daughters. He and his wife support the family through the income they earn from their general store. They have operated this business for two years and live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Xuyen sells sugar, toys, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business  and to prepare selling goods during the Vietnamese New Year. He will buy a greater variety of products; in particular, rice, sugar and milk. The additional materials will enable Xuyen to increase his sales. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and milk  to sell at his store.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past 12 years, Lien and her husband have operated a business selling construction materials. 

Lien would like a loan to purchase better quality and larger quantities of tiles to sell at her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers. Lien also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy better quality and larger quantities of tiles to sell at her store

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 32-year-old lady. She has been running her business stitching clothes with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her husband also knows the techniques of stitching very well and earns enough to contribute to the family income. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, they are unable to meet with the daily demands of customers. For this reason, Saima requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine along with some spools of thread in different colors to create a means of increasing revenues. It will help them to generate a healthier source of income. Saima is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine along with some spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 35, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a welder. 

Loan started a sewing business 12 years ago. She makes clothes and sells fabric to her customers. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying fabric to make more clothes.  She will also use part of her loan to repair her house. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly, and that it will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes to sell, and also to repair her house.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 27 años de habita en casa sencilla y humilde junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 7 años y 5 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios doméstico, este oficio le permite llevar el sustento a sus hijos y colaborar con la economía de su hogar ya que con los ingresos de su esposo no logran cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. El piso de su vivienda actualmente es de tierra y desea encementarlo con el fin de dar condiciones más higiénicas a sus hijos, además, desea construir un muro de retención para evitar que el terreno se siga lavando.  Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Norma, 27, lives in a simple, modest house with her husband and two daughters, ages 7 and 5. She does housework for others to support her children and contribute to household expenses, as her husband's income doesn't cover all their expenses. 

The house floor is dirt, and she wants to lay a cement floor so that her daughters can live in healthier conditions. She also wants to build a retaining wall to keep the dirt from washing away. So she has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron so that she can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to lay a cement floor and build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, age 44 and unmarried, earns a living by operating a general store. She started her business 10 years ago on order to cover her living expenses. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Dung is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by buying more household items and a variety of soft drinks to stock in her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to boost her business turnover. 

Her goal is to expand her enterprise, thereby earning enough money to reinvest into her business for the future.

loans.use: to buy household items and a variety of soft drinks to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José, tiene 51 años de edad, está en unión de hecho;  tiene 7 hijos: 3 varones y 4 mujeres, el junto a su familia vive en el departamento de Sololá. Se dedica al cultivo de papa, esa actividad la heredó de sus padres, porque desde niño los ayudaba a cultivar la tierra. Realiza está actividad porque le gusta estar en contacto con la naturaleza y  además es la fuente de los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la compra de una cuerda de papa (0.0715 hectáreas) para luego comercializarlo. 
El sueño más importante de José es darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has 7 children, 3 sons and 4 daughters. He and his family live in the department of Sololá. He grows potatoes, work that he inherited from his parents, because he helped them cultivate the land since he was a little boy. He does this work because he likes to be in contact with nature, and in addition, it is the source of income that he uses to sustain his family.

He is applying for a loan of 7000 quetzales to buy a plot of land (0.0715 hectares) planted in potatoes, to later sell. 

José's most important dream is to give a good quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land (0.0715 hectares) planted in potatoes, to later sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 17 años de edad y 12 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y hace todo lo que este en sus manos para darles mejores condiciones habitacionales. Ella se dedica a la  prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace 5 años y es así como junto a su compañero de vida mantienen a economía de su hogar. Desea terminar de mejorar su vivienda ya que no cuenta con un corredor y esto incomoda cuando hace sol y cuando hay lluvias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos, cemento, arena y grava para construir el corredor de la vivienda y encementarlo, con el fin de contar con mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
María, 41, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two daughters, ages 17 and 12. Family is most important to her, and she does everything she can to improve her family's living conditions. María has been doing housework for others for five years to help her husband pay household expenses.

She wants to finish renovating her house, as it currently doesn't have a hallway, which makes the house uncomfortable when the sun is strong or when it's raining. So she has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy laminated sheeting, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to build a hallway and pour cement in her house and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheeting, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to build a hallway in her house.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh, 41 years old, is married. She has a daughter and a son, and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Hanh and her husband earn money by selling fabric and making clothing.

Hanh has run a sewing shop and sold fabric at her house for 12 years. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of fabric to sell to her customers and to make many different clothes for selling. Hanh hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fabric to sell and to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Kuloda

texts.en:
Kuloda is a 38-year-old housewife who is married to Binod in Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri district. Both of them are illiterate but know how to sign their names. She is blessed with two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is married while her sons are working in the family's fast food stall.

Her husband Binod runs a small fast food stall. Binod keeps himself busy in the stall selling different fast food items like chow mein, egg rolls, kebabs, pakoras etc. Their sons also assist their father in this work.

Kuloda works hard and manages the household works until nigh. Her husband’s monthly income is too low to cover their family expenses. Due to their poverty, Kuloda is unable to give an education to her sons. They are leading a hard life.
  
As their fast food is in great demand in her area, Kuloda wishes to expand the business by purchasing different kinds of essential food items to prepare more fast food items. She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to increase their selection of fast food items, which will enable her to make the business run smoothly.
 
Kuloda, in the future, wishes to open a restaurant with the profit from the business.  She also dreams of having a concrete house with the profits from her business and giving a better future to her children. Kuloda is very thankful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase food items to expand her fast food stall

loans.name: Alfred Azoh

texts.en:
Alfred Azoh is married and has five children. They all live in an eight room apartment house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life including inadequate capital to finance a business of his own, family problems, sickness, and death of his family members. 

With this new loan requested, Alfred Azoh will expand his business by buying poultry and farm seedings. In addition he will increase his farm size. He holds a positive view of this business succeeding because he has been doing it for so long and has regular customers who buy from him. With this business activity, the community will benefit from moderate prices and a reduced distance to buy from the market.

With the profit from this loan, he will cater for his family needs, ensure his children's education, expand his poultry and farming and also save some to undertake a bigger investment. He prefers loans from GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy poultry and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Она Шодигул. Ей 35 лет. Она с семьей живет на районе Шахритус. У Шодигула большая семья и для ее обеспечения она хочет внести свой вклад и начать семейный бизнес. Шодигул планирует заняться животноводством. Ей будет помогать вся семья. Она решила разводить крупнорогатых скотов у себя дома, в коровнике. Уже много лет дома у Шодигула дома имеется несколько голов крупнорогатого скота для семейных нужд. Она очень много знает о деятельности скотоводства, и решила свой опыт и навыки использовать в бизнесе. Но для начала деятельности ей не хватает средств для покупки пару голов быков и коров. Она просит кредит. Сумма, которая ей не обходим, является не большой, потому что для деятельности купли и продажи скота нужны большие деньги. Шодигул не стала рисковать и начать с малого и с надеждой на развитие бизнеса в будущем и с надеждой на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: This is Shodigul. She is 35 years old and lives with her family in the Shahritus district. Shodigul has a large family, and to support it she wants to invest her savings into beginning a family business. She plans to practice animal husbandry. The whole family will help her. She decided to raise cattle on her property, using a small barn. She has had a few cattle for many years, for family use. She knows a lot about raising livestock, and decided that she could use her experience and skills in business. However, she doesn't have the funds to buy a couple of cows and bulls to begin the business. She is asking for a loan. The amount she needs isn't large although buying and selling livestock requires a lot of money. Shodigul decided to start small instead of risking everything, and hopefully expand the business in the future, hopefully with your help.

loans.use: To begin a new business in animal husbandry and buy a few head of livestock.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is a 28-year-old housewife who lives with her husband Rahim in Ghalaigram of Dhupguri. They have three children and all of them are students. Serina and Rahim are both are illiterate and only know how to sign their names but both are very ambitious to give a good education and a bright future to their children.

Serina is a homemaker while her husband is a farmer. They have their own land where Rahim cultivates different vegetables and supplies them to the market but his income is not sufficient to raise their children to lead a proper lifestyle in this expensive era.
 
Now Serina plans to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in potato cultivation by buying potato seeds, fertilizers and other necessary supplies. She wants to increase the family income and to give financial assistance to her husband with the profit from her potato cultivation. Though there are some risks in cultivating potatoes, she still prefers to use more farmland for this business because potatoes are in great demand in her area as well as a popular vegetable used in most of the Indian dishes. 

Serina thanks Kiva and BJS for the loan that makes her dreams true.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Huyenh

texts.en:
Huyenh, age 45, makes and sells slippers to earn a living. He lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with his daughter and son. 

Huyenh is sometimes unable to provide the volume of slippers required by his customers. He has therefore requested a loan. He will use his loan funds to buy a larger stock of material with which to make slippers, an investment that will allow him to increase his production so that he can meet his customers' needs. 

He hopes that his business will ensure that his children can have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of materials with which to make slippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale in order to fulfill his role as a Community Knowledge Worker in his local community

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huampani Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE HUAMPANI” está conformada por 07 socios(as) quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio y a prestar servicios independientemente. Víctor tiene 51 años es conviviente con 03 hijos mayores de edad. El se dedica desde muy joven a prestar servicios de fumigación ambiental.  Sus principales clientes son sus conocidos y personas externas. Y a la vez trabaja en la municipalidad de la zona donde radica. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva bomba para fumigar. Su mayor deseo es ampliar sus servicios fumigación ambiental. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Víctor es el segundo del lado derecho.
texts.en:
“Las Triunfadores de Huamoani” communal bank has seven members, who run a variety of businesses and services. Víctor, 51, has a domestic partner and three grown children. He has been offering fumigation service from a young age, and he has both regular and new clients. He also works with the municipality.

He will use this loan to buy a new fumigation pump. His great wish is to expand his fumigation service. The group thanks Kiva lenders for the funding. Víctor is second from the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new fumigation pump.

loans.name: Rafael Armando

texts.es: Rafael tiene  25 años  de edad y trabaja como asistente dental desde hace tres años. Habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de dos meses. Para él lo más importante es su familia y por ella hace todo lo que este en sus manos para darles mejores condiciones de vida. Desea mejorar la cubierta del techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve el agua se filtra dañando sus pocas pertenencias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines para reparar el techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rafael is 25 years old, and has been working as a dental assistant for three years. He lives with his wife and 2 month old son in very modest living conditions. His family is the most important thing to him, and he does everything he can to improve their quality of life. 

Rafael wants to improve the roof of his home. It is currently deteriorated and when it rains, water gets through and damages their few belongings. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy sheet metal and roofing supports to repair the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and roofing supports to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel belongs to one of the groups called Mutuma from central Kenya.  His wife, like other women in the county, has faced a lot of challenges when it comes to accessing fuel for cooking and lighting. She has to walk a long distance every weekend to collect enough firewood for the week, and to buy kerosene for lighting. Having joined the group recently, he learned from the older group members that he could get an alternative source of fuel for his wife that was cleaner, cheaper and more convenient. He learned that his family could enjoy solar power for lighting and avoid buying kerosene. The economical cook stoves for firewood and charcoal would also enable her wife save 50% of the fuel consumption. Hence, the one-week load of firewood would last for two weeks, saving her energy and time. He has received the two items on credit and will be able to repay in 24 months from his farm proceeds. This is a great gift for his family over Xmas.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp and an economical cook stove.

loans.name: Latika

texts.en:
Latika is a 56-year-old woman who is married to Narayan. They live in Dhupguri with their two children. Both of them are illiterate but can sign their names. She is a housewife and her husband is involved in the fruit business. He sells different kinds of seasonal fruits in their local village market. They have a small fruit shop in the local bazaar. They have been involved in this business for many years. They possess a very small stock of fruits, as the demand as well as the price of seasonal fruits, are becoming too high these days and they are unable to maintain stock and meet the demands of their customers.  

Now Latika decided to increase her business, and for that reason, they need some capital. Latika decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a variety of seasonal fruits to sell. She would like to invest the loan in her fruit business so that she can run a smooth business with a large profit, which will ultimately help her to increase her income. She knows that she will be able to extend her business with the earned profit from her new business plan. She is a lady of great enthusiasm and never wants to stop fighting for her family’s well-being. Latika sincerely thanks Kiva and BJS for their support.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Danivas

texts.en:
Danivas is a 30 year old from Nakuru. He is married to Janet, and they are blessed with three children, ages one, nine, and 12.

He operates as a farmer for both crops and animals. He has been in the business for 11 years and earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, and he plans to use the loan to buy an incubator and also boost his farming activities.

Danivas anticipates using his profits to pay back his loan, to educate his children, and also to buy a motorcycle. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot and build houses for rent so he can increase his monthly income and have better living standards.

loans.use: to buy an incubator and boost his farming activity.

loans.name: Simoo

texts.en: Simoo is a 46-year-old lady with no children. She makes and sells pancakes to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Simoo has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, a large frying pan, yeast and baking soda. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, a large frying pan, yeast and baking soda.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 48 years old. He is married and has two sons. Rovshan has engaged in poultry breeding for twenty-five years. His wife helps him breeds cocks, hens and geese. Rovshan sells poultry and eggs at the bazaar. Sometimes he sells goose down too. His monthly income is 170 AZN.

Azerbaijani peoples’ demand for bird meat is high. They like to cook delicious national dishes (chicken with sweets to pilaf, fried goose, hen or chicken with different tasty spices and flavors, levengi etc.).  Goose down is used to make soft pillows and warm coverlets or warm coats.

Rovshan is borrowing 1500 AZN.  This is his first loan from AqroInvest Credit Union. He wants to buy more poultry and cover the costs of breeding and keeping them.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and geese

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 18 años,  16 años y 13 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de medicina de forma ambulante. Todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su municipio para ofertar sus productos. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y desea ir mejorando poco a poco. Actualmente, la cocina la tiene al aire libre y desea construir las paredes y el techo de la misma para proteger sus pocas pertenencias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para comenzar la construcción del cuarto de la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en: Ana, 45, lives in her own house with her husband and three children, ages 18, 16, and 13. She sells medicines as a street vendor every day in the main neighborhoods in her town. Her living conditions are very modest, and she wants to improve them bit by bit. Right now, she cooks outside, and she wants to build walls and a roof to protect her few belongings. She has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails to start building a kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails to buy a kitchen.

loans.name: Cecilia Noemy

texts.es: Cecilia de 27 años de edad es madre soltera de una niña de 8 años de edad. Habita en casa  muy humilde junto a su hija y grupo familiar y se dedica al comercio de ropa y zapatos de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo. Gracias  a su carisma y buenos productos que ofrece ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieran más. Su vivienda es muy humilde y desea reparar el techo de la misma ya que con el tiempo y el sol se ha deteriorado y es necesario cambiarlo lo antes posible. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para proceder  a hacer las mejoras pertinentes.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 27, is the single mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She lives in a very modest house with her daughter and relatives. She has been selling clothing and shoes as a street vendor for many years. She has a lot of customers, who each day prefer doing business with her more than ever because she is friendly and offers good merchandise.

Her house is very modest, and she wants to repair the roof, which has deteriorated with time and the effects of the sun. It is important to change the roof as soon as possible, so she has applied to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to do the needed repairs.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Lise

texts.en: Lise is 28 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, taros, yams, bananas and others that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Lise needs a loan to buy fertilizer, gloves, a rake, a wheelbarrow, a mist blower and shovels. She joined SPBD in 2013. Lise will use the profits from her sales to increase her family's living situation and also keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gloves, a rake, a wheelbarrow, a mist blower and shovels.

loans.name: Faris

texts.en:
Faris, age 45, sells fruit and vegetables at the bazaar. He has 20 years of experience and his monthly income is 110 AZN per month. He and his wife have a son and a daughter, and the son sometimes assists Faris in his business. Faris's wife is a homemaker.

Fresh fruits and vegetables are popular among Azeri people, who use them as ingredients in such dishes as jam, cakes, and pies. Fruits are also used to make fresh juices and stewed fruit dishes. Vegetables are used in a variety of soups, salads, and traditional dishes such as roasted eggplant.

This is Faris’s first loan from AqroInvest Credit Union. He has requested a 1000 AZN loan in order to expand his small business, since his current monthly income is not enough to cover his family's daily needs. 

Faris's goal is to offer his children a quality education and to provide them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. This loan is intended to be used to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending.

Maricel dreams of nothing more than having a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: 3.09.901.15Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Hà is applying for a loan to purchase fruit to resell. She has a retail business selling fruit. Hà is 43 years old and married with two children. Hà is the group leader of the 3.09.901.15 Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province with two dependents.

In 2012, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Francisca Marily

texts.es: Francisca Marily, mayor de edad  casada con dos hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como: diferentes estilos de ropa de niños, damas y caballeros, cosméticos, chinerias, prendas de oro, y otros productos mas, sus compras las realiza en otros municipios del país, y son al contado,los cuales distribuye a comerciantes de distintos lugares los cuales algunos son al contad y otros al crédito los cuales recupera semanal, la mayor parte de su mercadería se encuentran en cuentas por cobrar, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, calzado, cosméticos entre otros, uno de sus sueños es poder ver su negocio crecer y tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer sus mercadería, al igual que ver realizados a sus hijos en todos unos profesionales
texts.en:
Francisca Marily is married and has two children who she is still responsible for. She is originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. 

She is a small business owner who sells general merchandise such as different styles of clothing for men, women, and children, cosmetics, inexpensive Chinese goods, gold jewellery, and other products.  She buys her goods in cash in other towns, and sells them to vendors in different areas. Some vendors pay in cash, and others on credit, with weekly payments. The majority of her merchandise is sold on credit, with accounts payable. 

She will use this loan to purchase general merchandise such as various styles of clothing, footwear, and cosmetics, among others. It is one of her dreams to see her business grow and have a shop where she can sell her merchandise. She would also like to see her children finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, among other items.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a drug shop retail business, and has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week. Sylvia has applied for a loan of  300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more medicines, like tablets (Septrin, Paracetamol and Quinine) and syrups for her drug shop. Her major business challenges include seasonality, defaulters and electricity, which hinder her business operations. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked drug shop and also to educate her children to university.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more medicines like septrin, paracetamol, quinine and syrups for her drug shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, and crape to expand his business.

loans.name: 3.05.94.04.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lý has a business raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Lý is 60 years old and married with two children. Lý is the group leader of the 3.05.94.04.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Her children are grown.

In 2003, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lý has successfully repaid one loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lý hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita has managed a food vending business for more than six years earning well enought that she was able to repay her previous loan used in the business successfully. Aside from this, she also was engaged in selling grocery goods to earn more income. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to resell. Teresita wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Al-Samia Group

texts.en:
Al-Samia is a four-member group from Aden, Yemen. All the members are women. 

Samia, 34, is the mother of three children. Two of them are enrolled in public schools. Ten years ago, Samia decided to help her husband. Her husband works very hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothes, but, unfortunately, the money he makes is really not enough. 

So, Samia started going door-to-door, selling cosmetics and clothes. She intends to expand her business. Therefore, she asked for a loan of 50,000 Yemen Rial (YER) to buy clothes, perfumes, and incense to resell. She hopes that she will make profits from buying a lot of products and selling them to new clients in different quarters and places in her city.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, and incense to resell.

loans.name: Shantana

texts.en:
Shantana is a 25-year-old married woman living in Magurmari village in Dhupguri with her husband Tapan and two kids. They read up to class VII (grade 7) and class VI (grade 6), respectively. She is a housewife and her husband has been involved in an agricultural business for many years. They sell their agricultural crops, vegetables etc to the local village market to earn money.
 
Shantana now plans to grow potatoes on their land, as it is the best time to grow potatoes. She is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, urea, pesticides etc to farm good quality potatoes on her farm so that she can generate more income. At present, the Kaccha house (made of mud and straw) she is staying in with her kids is very uncomfortable, so she hopes to build a concrete house with the profit from her business. Shantana is grateful to Kiva and BJS for stretching their hands to overcome the financial disturbances she is facing every day.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, urea and other supplies

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 46-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. 

Parveen has been knitting hand-made embroidery at her home for many years. Her four daughters also help her with the completion of tasks related to embroidery. She proved herself to be a responsible and brave mother. During these years, she has attained a regular list of customers and she makes enough money to contribute to the family's income.

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, Parveen, the leader of her group, requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Pouk district of Siem Reap province, Chorn is 28 years of age and single. To make a living, he has been farming rice and working at a hotel in the province. The current business earns him about USD 5 per day, but he can save about USD 3 each day after daily expenses.
 
Chorn is just with VisionFund this cycle, and now he is applying for an education loan to pay for his university tuition fees. He hopes with this loan, he will obtain a higher education background, so that he can get a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fees.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a 46-year-old woman married to Binod. They live in Pramodnagar village in Dhupguri in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw) with their  son. She is a housewife, her husband is a farmer and her son works as a house painter.

Being a farmer, Binod cultivates many necessary crops and vegetables and sells them to the village market, but at present, their agricultural products are collapsing due to a lack of urea and pesticides. That’s why have been unable to farm huge quantities of crops and vegetables to sell. 

Purnima decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers for farming good quality potatoes along with other crops on her own land. This will enable her to grow potatoes and other vegetables in huge amounts so that she can sell them in the market. She knows that the profit she will gain from this business will help her to earn more income for her family and she will be able to lead a normal rural life. Purnima sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva as they came forward as a saviour of her business.

loans.use: To buy good quality potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Mi nombre es Mary, tengo 65 años y vivo en una casa propia, yo nací en el estado de Jalisco, pero vivo en la ciudad de México desde hace muchos años. Actualemente vivo sola, ya que todos mis hijos son independientes. Yo tengo una tienda de abarrotes desde hace poco más de 20 años, en ella vendo abarrotes y cremería. El negocio me ha dado estabilidad económica y también satisfacciones personales. Estoy solicitando el crédito para surtir mi tienda de mercancía. Me considero una persona honesta y siempre cuido de pagar mis créditos.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story.

My name is Mary.  I am 65 years old and I live in my own house.  I was born in the state of Jalisco but I have been living in Mexico City for many years. Currently, I live alone as my children are independent.  I have had a grocery store for a little more than 20 years, and I sell groceries and dairy products.  The business has given me economic stability and also personal satisfaction. I am asking for this loan so I can stock my store with merchandise. I consider myself to be an honest person and always repay my debts.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem is 54 years old and is married with three dependent children. Nem and her husband work in the same business cultivating rice, which is the important source of income for their family. Being a responsible mother, Nem works hard to lift her family out of poverty and provide them with a better quality of life.  She has been working in this field for nearly 30 years and has earned valued experience, which enables her to continually develop her farming business.

Currently Nem doesn't have a hygienic latrine at home, so she would like to build a one to protect the family from illness and promote their health. Due to inadequate capital, she has requested a loan to buy materials needed and pay for labor costs for performing the construction. She is able to do this thanks to the water loan program, offered by HKL with a special rate, which has encouraged Nem to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine to protect the family from illness and promote their health.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita, 50 years old, is a widow and lives at Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs.  

Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional feeds and piglets. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and would be able to expand to other municipalities. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to maintain more sanitary conditions easily.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business,

loans.name: Pia

texts.en:
Pia is married with three children. Pia is 41 years old and lives in Timan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Pia has grown pigs and sold pigs as her business for two years. Each month, she earns 18,000 PHP  doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy  piglets to raise. 

Pia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Pia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more medical drugs such as malarial drugs, cholera drugs and drips to expand his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Carole Cristina

texts.en:
Carole Cristina previously accessed a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase materials needed in furniture making like bamboo, nails, varnish and other materials. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a direct-selling business and sells frozen foods for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy more materials needed in furniture making, like bamboo, nails, varnish and other materials, products for her retail business such as soaps and processed foods. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carole Cristina dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials needed in furniture making, like bamboo, nails, varnish and other materials, products for her retail business such as soaps and processed foods.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 61 years old, single, and a resident of Cebulin, Plaridel. She earns a living through her bamboo business.

She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy inventories of bamboo for her to sell.

Erma deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy inventories of bamboo for her to sell.

loans.name: Rolando Elias

texts.es:
Rolando, necesita capital para efectuar la compra de CD, DVD, trapeadores, entre otros artículos para la ofrecer variedad de ofertas a sus clientes, pues está decidido a sacarle el mayor provecho a la temporada navideña.
El préstamo anterior le dio un crecimiento en su inventario y le dio como resultado una mejora en su economía, canelo sus deudas su familia vive en un estilo de vida mucho más adecuado.
texts.en: Rolando needs capital so he can buy CDs. DVDs, and mops, among other items.  He wants to offer a variety of products to his customers so he can earn as much as possible during the holiday season.  The previous loan allowed him to increase his inventory, and as a result his finances improved, and he was able to pay off some debt.  His family now has an improved lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy CDs, DVDs, mops, etc.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, age 43, runs a business along with her husband, selling beverages to members of their community. They live with their two daughters and one son in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nga would like to request a loan in order to buy a large stock of beverages in order to increase her sales and better meet her customers' needs. 

She hopes that her business will thrive so that she can ensure that her children will have a strong education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a large stock of beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Junita

texts.en: Junita is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is married. She is running a business in front of her house by doing computer services. She is making a good income from computer services and she wants to apply for a big loan for the future. She is living in a town near by the main road; so many people come to fix their computers. She opened her business in 2002 with her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy tools to fix computers.

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Robison, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children. One of them goes to school and the other one is still small. He has had three types of business: a motorcycle, a retail shop and he sells tap water. He has been in his business for four years now. He works from 6.30 to 8pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.
