This will be Robison's forth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling tap water and bought a motorcycle for transportation. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used his profit to pay school fees, cover household expenses and pay rent. He will use this loan to buy new products for his shop. He dreams of owning a big company.

Robison will share this loan with his loan group 'Vigae'. The four members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new products for his shop.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Mohamed from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married with one child, aged 13 years. He began this business because he saw that operating a business could be profitable.  

Mohamed runs a general store. He sells beverages, cigarettes, pure water, and tin milk. He has been running this business for eight years. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and electricity power supply.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as beverages, cigarette, pure water, and tin milk. The extra income from this will allow him to pay his installments and cover his daily meals. In the future, he plans to open another shop. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as beverages, cigarettes, pure water, and tin milk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cow skin for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and cassava, which will aid her in improving her "banku" sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items such as assorted drinks, cigarettes, pure water and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, gari, and rice, thus aiding her to improve her sales.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old from Olklou. He is married to Veronicah and they are blessed with one child aged one year old.

He has been operating his business of motorcycle transport for the last two years and to enable him get the motorcycle serviced for effective and efficient services, he has applied for his third loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. His monthly income is 20,000 KES. He intends to use profits realized from his improved business to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya and to buy another motorcycle.

In the future, John hopes to live a poverty free life.

loans.use: to get his motorcycle serviced and assist his spouse to buy stock for her greengrocer.

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Sorie from OI C Ropolo, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with three children.  For the past 20 years, Sorie has established a shoe business. He began his business because he considered it the best option to provide better living conditions. He works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. He says that the main challenges are storage facilities and high competition in the market.

Sorie requires a loan in order to buy slippers, shoes, and crape to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase business and become successful. In the future, Sorie plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, and crape to expand his business.

loans.name: Delmy Jeannette

texts.es:
Delmy, se dispone a invertir en su negocio necesita capital para comprar diversidad de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, con lo que aprovechara la apoca de fin de año y aumentar sus ventas, el resto lo utilizara para comprar más ingredientes para elaborar la comida y pupusas.
Con el crédito anterior lo utilizo para aumentar su inventario dándole como resultado mejores ganancias, nuevos clientes, y ha conseguido salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Delmy is ready to invest in her business. She needs capital to buy a variety of clothing for men, women, and children. She wants to take advantage of the end of the year season and increase her sales. She will use the rest to buy more ingredients to make dishes and pupusas [stuffed tortillas].

She used the previous loan to increase her inventory resulting in better earnings, new customers, and has managed to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and more ingredients for food production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses, trousers and a variety of clothing materials for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biscuits, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Xukmi

texts.ru: Хукми жизнерадостная и позитивная женщина. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Живёт она со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Чтобы иметь доход в семье для проживания, все члены семьи стараются работать как могут. Сама Хукми работает руководителем по вышиванию. Она давно уже научилась этому делу, вышивать национальные головные уборы. И за всё это время своей деятельности она успела изучить все тонкости своего дела. Сыновья Хукми работают шофёрами маршрутного такси. Они перевозят пассажиров по мету назначения. Этот вид бизнеса приносит хороший доход. Поэтому они хотят купить собственный микроавтобус, чтобы расширить охват предоставления данной услуги. Поэтому Хукми хочет приобрести для своего сына микроавтобус. Собственных денежных средств у них недостаточно, поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку микроавтобуса. Она надеется что с получением этого кредита, она сможет улучшить свое семейное положение. Хукми заранее благодарит  Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Xukmi is a cheerful and optimistic woman. She is married and has four children. She lives with her family in a small town. Everyone in the family does what they can to earn money for living expenses. Xukmi herself works as an embroidery supervisor. She learned how to sew traditional headwear a long time ago. Over all the time she practiced she was able to learn the smallest details of the work. Xukmi's sons work as drivers of taxi vans. The transport passengers on a fixed route. This type of business earns a good income, so they want to buy their own minibus to expand their services. Xukmi therefore wants to buy a minibus for her son. They do not have enough personal capital, so she came to Arvand, and would like to get a loan to buy a minibus. She hopes to receive a loan so that she can improve her family's position. Xukmi thanks Arvand in advance for the support and confidence.

loans.use: to buy a minibus

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, ha tenido un aumento en la demanda de sus productos, pues con el crédito anterior pudo mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, aumento la producción de tortillas, atrajo  a nuevos clientes, ha mejorado la economía pues le da la oportunidad de cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas y continuar mejorando el estilo de vida familiar.
En esta ocasión solicita capital para invertir en la compra de maíz, cal, leña, y gas propano, son sus implementos básicos para continuar trabajando y generar los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca has seen an increase in the demand for her products since thanks to the previous loan she was able to improve her service to her customers.  She increased tortilla production and attracted new customers. Her finances have improved as she was able to make her loan payments on time, and she has continued to improve her family's lifestyle.

At this time she is asking for capital to invest in the purchase of corn, lime powder, firewood, and propane gas.  These are basic elements that enable her to continue to work and generate the income she needs to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, and propane gas.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar chocolate, frutas, azúcar y pago de mano de obra, lo que le permitirá realizar los diferentes productos que hace en su casa para vender y también podrá recolectar la cosecha.
El préstamo anterior le dio la oportunidad de fortalecer la venta de su casa así como también cultivo mejores granos y obtuvo una cosecha abundante, ha cancelado sus deudas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Rosa finds herself in need of requesting a new loan in order to buy chocolate, fruit, sugar, and to pay for labor. These will allow her to make different homemade products to sell as well as help harvest her crops. Her previous loan gave her the opportunity to strengthen the sale of her house as well as cultivate better grains. She obtained an abundant harvest and paid off her debts as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy chocolate, fruits, sugar, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels to sell greater quantities of her tasty Banku.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie. She previously took an 18,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan that she used to purchase additional supplies of chicken and pork needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to pay for additional supplies of chicken and pork. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lanie hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her fellowship group members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of chicken and pork needed in her business.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Phen is 35 years old and married with eight children. She is engaged in an agricultural business growing rice and cassavas on a few pieces of land in Kampong Thom province. As the needs of the family are increasing day to day, Phen is seeking ways of increasing her income in order to meet their needs and aiming to invest in the purchase of cashew nuts in bulk from local plantations, and continue selling them to traders at a profitable price. Due the shortage of capital, Phen is asking for a loan as her working capital to buy cashew nuts. Phen hopes this will result in an increase of her income that will ensure food security for her household.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cashew nuts in bulk from local plantations, and continue selling them to traders at a profitable price.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия добросовестная женщина. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. Она родилась в 1959 года. Зулфия разведена и имеет 2 детей. Одну дочь и одного сына. Она сама вырастила своих детей, так как ее муж бросил ее много лет назад  женился на другой женщине. Зулфия более 23 года работает в частной организации заведующим складом. Она честно выполняет свою работу и имеет хорошую репутацию среди сотрудников. Зулфия и ее дети живут в старом и маленьком домике. Она хочет отремонтировать дом, но не имеет денег. Зулфия запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a conscientious woman. She is dedicated and hard working. She was born in 1959, is divorced and has two children: a daughter and a son. She has raised the children herself, since her husband left her many years ago to marry another woman. She has worked in a private organization as a stockkeeper for over 23 years. She does her work responsibly and has a good reputation among her coworkers. Zulfiya and her children live in a small, old home. She wants to remodel the house, but doesn't have the money to do so. Zulfiya is asking for a 3000 somoni loan to buy building materials. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair a house

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис молодая и умная женщина. Она разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Наргис имеет высшее образование. Она работает в Таджикском государственном Университете Политики и Бизнеса в отдела кадров. Она работает более 2 лет. Наргис и ее ребенок живут на ее зарплату. Она хочет купить ноутбук и телефон на праздник Новый год, но не имеет денег. Наргис запрашивает займ на сумму 5800 сомони для покупки ноутбука и телефона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nargis is a young and intelligent woman. She is divorced and has one child. Nargis has a college education. She works at the Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business in the personnel department. She has worked there for over two years. Nargis and her child live on her income. She wants to buy a notebook computer and telephone for the New Year holiday, but doesn't have the money. She is asking for a 5800 somoni loan to buy a notebook and mobile phone. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a notebook and mobile phone

loans.name: Betty Josefa

texts.es:
Betty tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

Betty se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz crianza de cerdos y a vender productos de yambal que son productos de belleza . Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza y alimentacion para los cerdos como balanceado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas cada 15 días dependiendo la siembra y cada semana para la alimentacion de los cerdos.

El sueño es comprar terreno para los cultivos y aumnetar la produccion. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Betty is 25 years old and lives in a civil union with her partner and two children in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Rios.  The members of the 27 de Mayo (May 27) communal bank work in agriculture and live in the neighborhood of Cadial where they all practically grew up. Most work in agriculture or in livestock. Betty works in agriculture, growing corn and raising pigs, as well as selling Yambal beauty products.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy urea, insecticides, liquid week killer, and food for the pigs such as feed. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops. She goes to Ventanas every 15 days to buy supplies and sell her products, depending on the crop; and she goes every week to buy food for the pigs.  Her dream is to buy land for the crops and increase production. In her free time she likes to watch TV and take walks through the fields.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, and food for the pigs such as feed.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam is 22 years old and married and lives with her family in a rural village of Mean Chey, Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. 

Lam and her husband work in the construction sector, which is the main source of the family’s income. They have been doing this for five years and together earn approximately USD 13 per day.

To assist them in their travelling needs, Lam needs a loan of USD 800 to buy a motorcycle they can use for commuting to work. This will allow them to cut down daily costs incurred by them in commuting. 

She expresses her thanks to all the lenders for their good will in helping them develop their living status.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle she and her husband can use for commuting to work.

loans.name: Brenda's Group

texts.en:
Brenda’s group has six group farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. The group represent a total of 53 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Brenda is pictured on the right of the Ebeneza Group with her hand raised.	

Brenda is 37 years old and has been a farmer for seventeen years. Brenda works as a farmer to provide for her four children. The community and other farmers know Brenda as hardworking and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community, such as the women's group and burial committee. Brenda described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Brenda first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Brenda joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Brenda plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Brenda’s own life was improved because she has more farm training, has more farm group support and was able to feed the family.
  							
Brenda and the Ebeneza Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. 

Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
	
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Bek

texts.ru: Бек жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Сам Бек работает шофёром грузовой машины, у него есть собственная машина для этого. От этой работы он получает хороший доход. А также Бек получает хороший доход от своего бизнеса. Уже несколько лет Бек занимается животноводством. Этот бизнес является  основным и стабильным бизнесом Бека. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Два сына Бека работают в России строителями, и также присылают домой деньги. Но так как животноводство приносит хороший и стабильный доход, Бек желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Бек обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Бек заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Bek is a cheerful and hardworking man. He is married and has three children. They are a very close family, living in a rural area. In order to earn money for the family, everyone tries to do what they can to earn an income. Bek himself is a truck driver, and he has his own truck for this work. The job doesn't earn him a great income, but he also earns money from his own business. For several years Bek has been raising livestock. It is his principal and most stable business. He raises and sells animals, and his wife helps with the work by caring for the livestock, and also selling milk from the animals. Bek's two sons are working in construction in Russia, and they send money home. But since raising livestock earns a good and stable income, Bek wants to expand the business. He needs to buy a few more head to raise and later sell. To do this Bek contacted Arvand, and would like a loan to purchase animals. He hopes that the business will develop successfully and bring big profits to improve his family's standard of living. Bek thanks Arvand for its support in advance.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cows and male goats to slaughter and sell by weight

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is a 38-year-old Cameroonian, divorced with five children. The oldest is sixteen in secondary school, while the youngest is four in primary school. She has been in this business for over seven months, which makes her experienced. Her business is likely to succeed, because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her profit by sixty percent. Her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy a locally made grinding machine.

loans.name: Alo

texts.en:
Alo is a 25-year-old lady from Maynaguri. She has her husband Bakul and two children in her family. Both Alo and her husband have not completed school. They admitted one of their children to school in class II (grade 2). Alo is a housewife who cares for her family all day long.

Her husband is a cycle van puller who rents a van from a local owner but his income is too low. Alo made a plan to give financial support to her husband by starting a new business selling dairy products, which are in great demand in her remote area. She decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase cow so she can sell milk, ghee, curd and many other dairy products in the village market to increase her family's income. 

She is struggling a lot to earn money so that her children do not suffer from poverty. Alo is very courageous and ambitious to start her own business because she is confident that she can give her children a higher education and run the family smoothly with the profit from her dairy business. She is very obliged to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to sell milk and dairy products

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a 42-year-old woman married to Jogesh, 47 years old. They live in Devinagar village in Maynaguri with their two children. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their children are in class XII (grade 12) and class X (grade 10), respectively. 

Anjana’s husband is a businessman who sells paddy in the local market. They want to expand their business by buying more stock of paddy, but for that they need some capital. Anjana is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more stocks of paddy (unmilled rice). She has chosen this business because there is a large demand for paddy in her area as well as throughout the West Bengal region. 

She wishes to establish their children with a proper education and establish them in life. She wishes to employ some rural women to assist her in sowing and harvesting paddy seeds, so that she can obtain good quality rice to sell in the village market.

She gladly thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more paddy (unmilled rice) to sell

loans.name: Usaha Ternak Group

texts.en:
Wayan and all members of Usaha Ternak Group decided to continue to borrow from MUK. Because they need to increase the population of their pigs, they need a new loan. They will need a loan until they can support their business by themselves.

Wayan gets full support from her husband. He helps her to maintain the pigs. She now has nine piglets. This loan will be used to purchase superior feed. Wayan needs a Vet who is always ready when she is needed. The profits will be saved to be capital for her business. The group has one new member.

loans.use: to buy superior quality feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is 38 years old, and married to John. They are blessed with two children who are 18 and 15 years old.

She owns a green grocery and has been in the business for 13 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for her third loan of KES 35,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the money to boost her business by adding more stock of fruits and vegetables.

She anticipates using her profits to pay her loan, educate her children and boost her business. She hopes to buy a plot and build rental houses in the future to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fredy Humberto

texts.es: Fredy de 40 años de edad es viudo desde hace 12 años. Habita en casa sencilla pero propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Fredy se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad y es así como logra mantener  la economía de su hogar. Su vivienda necesita cambio de la cubierta de techo ya que se encuentra dañado por causa de las lluvias, el sol y el tiempo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra lámina galvanizada y madera para proceder a la reparación del techo lo antes posible y contar con mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Fredy, 40, has been a widower for 12 years.  For a long time he lives house that is simple but his own. Fredy provides security services and thus is able to maintain his household economy.  His home needs a change of roof cover since it was discovered to be damaged from heavy rains, sun and weather.  Due to all of this he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to use to purchase galvanized corrugated metal sheets and wood in order to repair the roof as soon as possible and have greater safety.

loans.use: to buy galvanized corrugated metal sheets and wood to repair the roof covering.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 43 years old, is from Nakuru. He is married to Justa and they are blessed with four children who are 20, 18, 15 and 13 years old.

He has been in the business of motorcycle transport for six years. To enable him to start a business for his spouse selling cereals, he has applied for his third loan of KES 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 10,000 and his intention is to use the profits realized from his expanded business to pay his loan to VisionFund Kenya and to educate his children. His hope and dream for his future business and family is to be prosperous.

loans.use: To start a cereals business for his spouse to run

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 20 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de antojitos dulces como poleada con leche. Todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su localidad para ofrecer sus deliciosas poleadas con leche las cuales son muy demandadas por sus clientes. Desea dar mayor seguridad a su casa por lo que desea levantar un muro alrededor de su vivienda. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito  FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento y grava para comenzar la reparación lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is twenty years old and lives in her house, which she owns, with her young 6-year-old daughter.  She is a single mother and makes a living selling sweet snacks like "poleada con leche", a hot drink made from milk and flour.  She passes through the main areas of town every day to offer her delicious poleada, which her customers love.  

She hopes to give her home a higher level of security by building a wall around her house.  She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of bricks, sand, cement, and gravel.  She will begin building the wall as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, and gravel so that she can build a wall around her home.

loans.name: Outfafa Group

texts.en:
Mary is one of the members of the "Outfafa" group and she has worked for a number of years. She is the mother of four independent children. She sells second hand clothing which she was able to start with the little money given to her some years ago. She is working full-time now with her business as she has many goals and dreams. Not only for herself but also for her grown children. She is 65 years but very strong and active toward business. She wants to open another sales location and second hand clothing too. She knows this would require a lot of effort but she trusts that God will help her achieve this. 

Together with her group members, knocking at ID-Ghana's door to request for loan amount of GHS 3100 to invest in various businesses.

loans.use: To buy 2 bales of second hand clothing and sell to customers.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four grown-up children. Claudia has been in the rice farming business for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income.

Claudia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and to pay for labor. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Claudia hopes to make her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
Crecencia, tiene 47 años de edad vive en la calurosa ciudad de Nazca junto a su hermosa familia conformada por sus 3 hijos y esposo, Crecencia es una persona muy responsable y carismática, ella siempre está pendiente en darle la mejor atención a sus clientes, ya que ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su propio domicilio, donde vende diferentes productos, como gaseosas, abarrotes, golosinas, etc.
Crecencia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería y así tener más variedad de productos para sus clientes y obtener más ingresos.
El sueño de Crecencia es hacer crecer más su negocio y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Crecencia is 47 years old and lives in the warm city of Nazca with her lovely family made up of her husband and three children.  Crecencia is very responsible and charismatic and is always looking out for ways to provide better service to her customers.  She has a small store in her home, where she sells different types of products, such as soft drinks, grocery items, and snacks.

Crecencia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and will use the money to buy more merchandise and have a better variety of products to offer her customers and increase her income.

Her dream is to grow her business and in this pay provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is a married woman with three children- all of whom go to school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food and electricity.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a married 28 year-old young man with a one son and two daughters. For the past several years he has been operating a car wash located in Qabatia village near Jenin city, next to the main street where there is good traffic. This has been a profitable project and the main source of income for him.

Mahmoud is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a vacuum cleaner to clean cars. This will attract more customers and increase the laundry's capacity to wash more cars. This will increase his income.
Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: Buy a vacuum cleaner to clean cars

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a 41-year-old Palestinian man.  He is married and father to two sons.
For the past several years, Jumaa has had a butcher shop.  It has been profitable and the only source of income to the family, but also it needs more support to cover the costs. Jumaa wants to pay the cost of purchasing a new machine to clean chickens.  Jumaa is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from Faten for this purpose.
What distinguishes this project is that it is the only one in the area where he lives. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve the family's income, which will enable them to live in better conditions.
Jumaa is photographed in his shop while he is working.

loans.use: Buy machine to clean chickens

loans.name: Arkan

texts.en:
Arkan is a 23-year-old young man, and he is married with three daughters. He is a municipal employee with a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs and expenses. 
Arkan is requesting 800 USD loan from FATEN to help him pay his daughter's medical expenses, who is suffering from a disease of convulsion in nerves. This will improve Mohammad's daughter health to better enable her to live in normal conditions with the family. Arkan and his daughter are photographed in the picture.

loans.use: Pay his daughter's medical expenses

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a 30-year-old young man who is married and a father of two sons and two daughters. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.
For the past three years, Ramadan has been buying and selling motorcycles, which has been a profitable project and has many loyal customers, but it needs more support to cover the costs. Ramadan is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of motorcycles for sale. This will allow him to offer a better selection for his customers to buy, which will improve the family's income positively.
Ramadan is photographed near the motorcycles he buys.

loans.use: Buy motorcycles for sale

loans.name: Flerida

texts.en:
Flerida is a hardworking mother from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years old and helps provide for the family through her clothing business. 

She joined Paglaum MPC in 2013 and enjoyed the insurance benefits of the cooperative. She is seeking a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase additional inventory of dry goods like clothes, shoes, and other items to sell. She wants to increase her sales by adding more inventories. 

She hopes to provide education for her two children and save some for retirement.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie Luz

texts.es: Marjorie de 19 años es estudiante de Administración de Negocios Internacionales. Este es su primer año en la universidad  y académicamente le va muy bien, lo que más desea es terminar su carrera para convertirse en una gran profesional, en sus horas libres se dedica al trabajo de cosmetología así puede ayudarse con algunos gastos como materiales de estudio y movilidad. Marjorie ha solicitado este crédito para pagar la pensión de un nuevo ciclo en la universidad  con esta ayuda continuara sus estudios sin pensar en la parte económica que es un obstáculo para muchos jóvenes como ella, quiere agradecer a los inversionistas de KIVA por este gran apoyo.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 19 years old and a student of Management and International Business.  This is her first year in university and she is doing very well academically.  What she really wants is to become a great professional.  She works as a cosmologist in her spare time and it helps her cover some expenses such as study materials and transportation.

Marjorie is asking for this loan to pay for a new loan to pay for a new university cycle so she can continue her studies without having to worry about money, which is an obstacle for many young people like her.  She would like to express her gratitude to the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita helps her husband manage their own farm for a living. She has been growing and harvesting bananas for more than five years earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used to improve their farm. Recently, she borrowed a new loan again to buy organic fertilizer to boost their farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma earns a living selling meat. She is stationed at Sindangan market for her displays. She works hard to raise her 3 school-aged children, as she wants to support her husband for their daily needs. The business has been operational for 20 years and promises good sales of Php 15,000 per month. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of Php 50,000 to open a convenience meat shop. She wants to expand her business to nearby municipalities.

loans.use: to open a convenience meat shop.

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es: María de 64 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer admirable quien a su edad trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Es muy conocida por sus vecinos como una mujer responsable, admirable y dedicada en lo que hace. María se dedica a la venta de ropa  de forma ambulante la cual es muy demandada por sus clientes.  Actualmente no cuenta con un baño  en buen estado por lo que desea invertir en la construcción del mismo y además, en la construcción de una canaleta para la salida de las aguas lluvias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava para construir el baño y la canaleta lo antes posible.
texts.en: María is 64 years old and lives in her own house with her family.  María is an admirable woman and, despite her age, still works very hard to suppport the household. María is known by her neighbours as being responsible, admirable, and dedicated in her work.  María makees a living selling clothes as a street vendor, with her products in much demand.  María does not currently have a decent bathroom and so wants to build one, along with a gutter, in order to collect rain water.  María is applying for this loan from FUSAI in order to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel in order to build a bathroom and gutter as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel in order to build a bathroom and gutter as soon as possible.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is applying for a loan of $1000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 40 years old and she is married. She has three children.

She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko), books, pencils, cigarettes, sugar, salt, bread, soap, and water. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Adriana is living in a town near the school. Her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko), books, pencils, cigarettes, sugar, salt, bread, soap, and water for her store.

loans.name: Christinah

texts.en:
Christinah is married and has children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.  She has operated a food selling business, making dumplings, and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
A $1000.00 loan is offered to Paulina to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own work. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like home repair items, zinc, cement, sand, and stone. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Paulina is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy home repair items, zinc, cement, sand, and stone for her store.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is from Sindangan. She sells fruit and vegetables. She earns an income of Php 8,000 per month doing this type of work. She signed her membership to Paglaum MPC for additional funding needs. She wants to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables to raise her income by having enough inventories to sell. She wishes to save more for her retirement and to live a comfortable life ahead with her children.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells food at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 4 years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of oranges, pineapples, tomatoes, cabbages, Irish potatoes, and passion fruit. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and transportation. She is aspiring of becoming wholesaler and also getting a permanent residence.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of pineapples, oranges, cabbage, Irish potatoes and passion fruit.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a highly spirited  entrepreneur who does farming and produces fruit trees like mango in Misamis Occidental. He in fact has been many years in this business and was so successful that he was able to support his family and successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC that he used to add capital. 

Recently, he has just borrowed an amount from GDMPC micro-finance for additional capital and to buy fertilizers and organic pesticides. He hopes that in time, his business will expand.

loans.use: for additional capital and to buy fertilizers and organic pesticides

loans.name: Daniel Alfonso

texts.es: A sus 56 años Daniel trabaja muy duro para mantener a su familia y  mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Daniel es albañil y agricultor, estos oficios le permiten llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y dar a sus  hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Actualmente, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y colaboran con los gastos del hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ya que el techo de su vivienda se ha deteriorado y desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Espera poder contar con este crédito que solicita a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para dar inicio a la reparación del techo que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
At 56, Daniel works very hard to support his family and improve their living conditions.  

Daniel is a construction worker and farmer.  These positions allow him to provide for his family daily and give his children better living conditions.  Currently, his sons are now adults and work with him on the living expenses.  He wants to improve their housing conditions since the roof of their house has deteriorated, and he wants to prove greater safety for his family.

He hopes he can rely on this loan he's requesting from FUSAI to use for purchasing galvanized corrugated metal sheets and wood to start repairing the roof they so badly need.

loans.use: to buy galvanized corrugated metal sheets and wood for repairing the roof.

loans.name: Felis

texts.en: Felis appreciates her previous Kiva loan which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Carminda

texts.en:
Carminda is applying for a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is married, she has four children, and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy items such as long sleeved and short sleeved shirts, trousers, and shorts.

Carminda opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $600.00. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions. She is happy with the loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy long sleeve and short sleeve shirts, trousers, and shorts

loans.name: Tony Angel

texts.es:
Tony, está casado, tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia, no posee ayuda del extranjero, para generar los ingresos con los que cubre los gastos familiares se dedica a cultivar maíz, es un oficio que aprendió en su familia, su mayor ventaja es que lo hace en tierras propias.
Solicita el capital para invertirlo en la en el pago de mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha de esta temporada, de esta forma tendrá en menor tiempo el maíz en su casa para luego venderlo con mucha anticipación y tener mejores anticipación.
Sueña con hacer mejoras a su vivienda y ofrecer un techo seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Tony is married, has 1 son, and lives with his family. He receives no aid from abroad. To generate the income needed to cover family expenses, he cultivates corn. This is a skill that he learned from his parents. Tony's major advantage is that he owns the fields that he cultivates.

Tony is requesting funds to invest in his farm by hiring labor for this season's harvest. In this manner, he will shortly have his corn in his house, and he is anxious to sell it and reap the benefits.

Tony's dream is to improve his home and offer his family a more secure roof.

loans.use: to invest in hiring agricultural laborers for this season's harvest.

loans.name: Bishara

texts.en: Bishara appreciates her previous Kiva loan which improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases cartons of plastic slippers to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc, cement,and Iron rod and head pan to expand his business

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda, a 42-year-old, hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three sons, and two daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is a carpenter. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Rasheeda is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She is a tailor, and wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will expand her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Rasheeda requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for her family's future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000, Amina wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Gladis Elena

texts.es: Gladis de 51 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 20 años y 17 años de edad. Habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar y sus hijos. Gladis es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce, demás, también se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante. Con el fin de dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia desea hacer algunas mejoras en su casa como: encementar el piso y hacer una canaleta para la salida del agua lluvia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder dar inicio a las reparaciones lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Gladis, 51, is a single mother of two children, ages 20 and 17.  She lives in her own house with her family and her children.

Gladis is a very hardworking and responsible woman.  She earns a living making and selling pan dulce [sweet bread] and providing housekeeping services.  The most important thing to her is her family, which is why she works hard to get them ahead.

To give her family better living conditions she wants to make some improvements in her house: cement the floor and make a gutter for the rain.  This is why she's asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in buying sand, cement, and gravel.  She hopes to be able to have this support so she can start the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and gravel

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1971 года. Зулайхо замужем и на воспитании имеет  4 детей. Она работает более 22 года в средней школе учителем. Она имеет высшее образование. Зулайхо получает маленькую зарплату. Ее муж строитель и он тоже не имеет большого дохода, чтобы обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Зулайхо должна провести свадебное торжество своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zulaykho is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1971, is married, and is raising four children. She has worked for over 22 years as a high school teacher, and she has a college education. Zulaykho earns just a small salary. Her husband is a construction worker and also doesn't earn a lot to provide for the family with. Zulaykho needs to throw the wedding celebration for her son, but doesn't have the money. She is asking for a 3000 somoni loan for the wedding festivities. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: pay for her son's wedding celebration

loans.name: Sandra Esmeralda

texts.es: Sandra de 39 años de edad  es madre soltera y habita junto a sus hijos de 20 años, 15 años y una hija de 4 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es que sus hijos se encuentren bien y puedan tener acceso a mejores oportunidades a las que ella ha tenido. Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias de forma ambulante. Este negocio le permite llevar el sustento  a su hogar y mantener la economía de su familia. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y sencillas y desea mejorar el área de cocina ya que las paredes y techo no están completas y se encuentran en mal estado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y lámina galvanizada y comenzar la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Sandra, 39, is a single mother and lives with her sons who are 20 and 15, and a daughter who is 4.   For her, the most important thing is that her children be well off and that they be able to have access to better conditions that she has had.

Sandra works as a mobile vendor selling clothing and sandals.  This business allows her to sustain her home and prove for the finances of her family.  Their housing conditions are very humble and simple and she wishes to improve the kitchen area since the walls and roof are not complete and are in bad shape.

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to use for buying brick, cement, sand, iron and galvanized metal sheets and start to improve it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and galvanized metal sheets to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
This is 43 year old Yayah from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 2 children, between the ages of 7 and 10 years. He began this business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to support his family.  

Yayah runs a general store. He sells drinks, cigarettes, pure water and tooth paste. He has been running this business 1 year. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  He says that he is very hardworking and hopes to educate his children.  His major hardship is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Yayah has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarette, pure water and tooth paste. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installment and have his daily meal. In the future, He plans to open another shop. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarette, pure water and tooth paste.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc, cement, Iron rod and head pan to expand his business.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en: Gorretti is married with two children and both her children go to school. She has additional family members (sisters). She sells timber at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 3 years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more pieces of timber. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and transportation. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale and also to build her own house.  She currently resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more pices of timber.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia busies herself with selling health products and food supplements. She is able to support her husband with their daily needs and the education of their two children. 

Delia is into dealership of health products and food supplements and wants to expand her business to purchase more inventory to sell. She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for the funding needs and applied for a loan of PHP 50,000. She is happy to earn an income of PHP 10,000 per month. She hopes to open an store outlet in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes and ladies jeans to expand his business.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelina is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Adelina has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Adelina requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, nylon thread, wire, etc., for her business.

Adelina has been in this business for six years. Adelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, nylon thread, wire, etc., for her business

loans.name: Gbrilla

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Gbrilla from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 and 12 years.  In 1991, Gbrilla established his clothing business. He began his business because after completing his sixth form, his family could not afford to pay his collage fees, so he  raised money to start up his business. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Gbrilla requires a loan in order to buy mens trousers and shirts to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan.  In the future, Gbrilla plans to renovate his business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mens trousers and shirts to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more beans, gari and bags of ground for resale.

loans.name: Catholic Center Group

texts.en:
These four members are part of a Nuru International group of farmers called Catholic Center, and is based within the Kuria West District. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Thomas, who is raising his hand, is 32 years old and has been a member of this group for more than two years now. He is married with four children who go to school.

Thomas is asking for a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to implement better farming methods that would lead to increased yields. If he gets a good yield of sorghum, millet and maize during the harvest of the 2014 long rains season, Thomas will be able to provide enough food for his family and sell the surplus. The money he gets from the surplus will be spent in investing in a business that would increase income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now and this is the source of their income.

Jeramie is asking for a loan to be used as an additional payment in buying a new boat engine. With this, her husband can go fishing and improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Jeramie hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to be used as an additional payment in buying a new boat engine.

loans.name: Yanina Yanela

texts.es:
Yanina tiene 34 años de edad  civil soltera tiene una hija, vive en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Yanina se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y arroz.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos y para dar mantenimiento especifico a sus siembras.
Vende sus productos en Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar su vivienda. El desafío que se enfrenta  el mal tiempo. En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia.
texts.en:
Yanina, 34, is single and has a daughter.  She lives in Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

Yanina is a member of the communal bank "Bruniquilde."  The members of this group live in Recinto Calabi in Ventanas canton, and they work in agriculture.

Yanina cultivates corn and rice.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to do some specific maintenance work on her crops.

Yanina sells her products in Ventanas.  Her dream is to improve her house.  She faces the challenge of bad weather.  In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to grow her crops

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a secondhand business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy clothes like shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, and short sleeves for kids and adults. She opened her secondhand business a year ago with her own working capital of $ 300.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.  Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy clothes like shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, and short sleeves for children and adults.

loans.name: Teresina

texts.en:
Teresina applying for a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is married and  this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, milk, sugar, coffee, salt, soap, water, and slippers.

Teresina opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $200.00. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, milk, sugar, coffee, salt, soap, water, and slippers

loans.name: Marta Margarita

texts.es: Marta de 22 años de edad  es madre soltera de dos niños y una niña y habita junto a ellos en casa propia. Ella trabaja como empleada en una fábrica cercana a su localidad  y además, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia. De esta forma lleva el pan de cada día a sus hijos y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones del piso de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava para dar inicio a la reparación del piso lo antes posible.
texts.en: Marta is 22 years old.  She is a single mother of two boys and a girl.  She lives with them in a home she owns. She works as an employee in a factory near where she lives, and with hard work she has also been able to set up a small shop in her home. In this way she feeds her children and pays her bills.  She would like to repair the floor of her home so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase sand, cement and gravel in order to start the repair work as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and gravel to repair the floor of her home.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is from the village of San Antonio, Alicia. She is 40 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still attending school.  Catherine wants to uplift them out of poverty, which is the reason why she works hard to improve her variety store.  She runs this business for almost four years and is able to earn a minimum of PHP 300 a day.  At this moment, she is in need of an additional PHP 10,000.  This allows her to buy grocery items to sell within her local community, such as canned goods, noodles, beverage, condiments and curls. Catherine hopes that through her requested loan amount she could further improve her financial stability and let her children finish their studies someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverage, condiments and curls.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 46 años de edad, está casada, tiene 7 hijos: 4 están casados y 3 viven con ella; ella vive junto a su familia en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella con mucho entusiasmo explica que se dedica a la preparación y venta de refacciones a domicilio. Para este oficio ella se apoya en una de sus hijas. Ella se dedica a esta labor porque a través de la misma obtiene los recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos familiares. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y con ella a logrado darles educación a sus hijos.
Además de esta actividad en su tiempo libre, ella también se dedica a los oficios domésticos con  una vecina de su comunidad, y los ingresos de esta actividad complementan su presupuesto familiar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de una estufa industrial.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las  condiciones de su vivienda y asi darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Estela is 46 years old.  She is married and has 7 children, 4 of whom are married and 3 of whom live with her.  She lives with her family in the Department of Sololá.  She enthusiastically tells us that she prepares and sells snacks door to door.  One of her daughters helps her with this work.  With this job she is able to earn money to cover the family's expenses.  She has done this work for 20 years, and it has enabled her to educate her children.  In her free time she also does domestic work with one of her neighbors.  This income supplements the family's budget.  She is requesting a loan for Q 3,000.00 to purchase an industrial stove.  Her greatest dream is to improve the conditions of her home in order to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial stove.

loans.name: Akiba

texts.en:
Akiba is married with one child who is underage. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Akiba has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past year. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUIYA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de LAFIABOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments de légumes et de la restauration à l’image de AWA qui est la deuxième personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à LAFIABOUGOU dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités.  Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. AWA qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à LAFIABOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter avoir avec ce prêt 20  kilogrammes de condiments, 3 sacs de céréales divers et de tubercules pour servir pendant longtemps sans pénurie.  Elle s’approvisionne à KANGARE sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à KANGARE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The DJIGUIYA group is part of the DANAYA association of Lafiabougou.  It comprises four women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties and are, on average, 25 years old.  Married with two children each, they are involved in various activities such as buying and selling condiments and vegetables.  Awa, a member of the group, prepares meals in her own restaurant.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the right.  These women live in extended traditional families in Lafiabougou, in the prefecture of Yanfolila (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They have been involved in small retail business for several years and their services are in high demand.

Eager to meet their customers' increasing needs, they decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso three years ago and this is their fifth solidarity loan.

Awa, who is also the group's representative, is quite well-known in Lafiabougou and she does an excellent job in her restaurant.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 kilos of condiments and three bags of various cereals and tubers, so that she can prepare meals for a long time, without suffering from any shortage.

She buys her goods from local wholesalers in Kangare and also resells in Kangare, on a retail basis.  She sells to both men and women and is paid in cash or on credit.

Awa is hoping to make a monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, which will help her to repay her loan and to further invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a hog grower and a vegetable vendor in her village. She is 45 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with seven children. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy rice bran for hogs and vegetables to sell. She hopes to keep improving her business to support her family’s daily needs and save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy rice bran for hogs and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Las Sonrrientes Group

texts.es:
Las Sonrientes es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 mujeres emprendedoras y alegres, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Tres Valles donde la principal actividad económica es el cultivo de caña de azúcar y de piña, Anastacia es uno de los integrantes del grupo, ella platica que desde hace 18 años tiene en su hogar una tienda de abarrotes, ella dice que cuando inicio con su negocio vendía desde su casa y poco a poco construyo el local en el cual esta instalado actualmente su negocio, ella dice que siempre le gusta tener bien surtido su negocio para estar en la preferencia de sus clientes y tener buenas ventas, su tienda de abarrotes es la más grande y mejor surtida de su colonia y comenta que lo que más le gusta del negocio es que la ha ayudado a brindar una mejor vida a su familia y ha conocido muchas personas 
Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudará surtirse de insumos (detergentes, jabón de baño,pan, papel higenico, arroz, frijol, refrescos, productos enlatados, leche, aceite, dulces, jugos) paras continuar con sus ventas, 
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continúe progresando y cada día mejore sus venta y ganancias. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo son: 
Guadalupe venta de ropa de cama
Corey venta de antojitos mexicanos
María de la luz entra de abarrotes 
Andrea venta de antojitos 
Neli venta de tortillas 
Brigida taller mecánico 
Marli purificadora de agua
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Sonrientes” and is made up of eight enterprising and happy women.  This group is located in Tres Valles where the raising of sugar cane and pineapples is the main economic activity.  Anastacia is one of the group’s members and she says that she has had a grocery store in her home for 18 years.  She started the business by selling out of her home and slowly built the store.  She likes keeping it well stocked so that her customers will prefer to buy from her and she will have good sales.  Her grocery store is the largest and best stocked in the neighborhood and she says that this business has helped her create a better life for her family and that she has met many people.

A Kiva and VisionFund loan will help her buy merchandise (detergent, bath soap, bread, bathroom tissue, rice, beans, soft drinks, canned goods, milk, cooking oil, candy, juices) so she can continue her sales.

She expects this investment to help her business continue and improve her sales and earnings daily.

The other members are:
Guadalupe sells bed clothing
Corey sells Mexican food
María de la luz sells groceries
Andrea sells food
Neli sells tortillas
Brigida has a mechanic shop
Marli purifies water

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.  Agustina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Agustina has been in this business for two years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Baby Jasmin

texts.en:
Baby Jasmin is 34 years old and is married with three children. With two children currently in school, Baby Jasmin works very hard to provide for them.

Baby Jasmin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Baby Jasmin has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, laundry soap, biscuits, candies, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Baby Jasmin would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 52 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom who are still in school.

Elena is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ervina

texts.en: Ervina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 42 years old. She is married and she has five children She is running a mini shop in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy items such as clothes for pregnant women, dresses, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, short sleeves and clothes for both kids and adults. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. She lives in a town near a school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene una edad de 37 años es casada y madre de 4 hijos, ama de casa y agricultora ya que desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de piña siendo sus padres sus tutores en este rubro ya que en su familia es una vocación. Ella tiene 6 años de educación estudiantil por lo que esta muy agradecida con Dios por el apoyo brindado por sus padres tanto moral como económico. Sus hijos son adolescentes y de sus 4 hijos 3 viven con ella siendo ellos apoyo en las diferentes actividades practicadas en el campo como la limpieza, aplicación de abono, fungicidas entre otros. Sus clientes son los diferentes viajantes que se desplazan por la CA-5 de norte a sur y de este a oeste siendo esta calle la principal en el país.  
Ella tiene muchos sueños para con su familia y sus cultivos siendo uno de ellos la prosperidad de sus hijos apoyando a cada uno de ellos en sus estudios, metas y con un patrimonio que ayude al ingreso de sus hogares o a poder construir sus viviendas. Para con sus cultivos seguir incrementando la producción que conlleve al mejoramiento continuo y al desarrollo de su familia y hogar mediante la siembra de otros productos como yuca y café. También ella quisiera en un futuro poder arreglar su casa de habitación la cual necesita mejoras. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder dar asistencia a sus cultivos de piña y obtener una excelente producción para esta temporada.
texts.en: Lucia is 37 years old.  She is married and mother to 4 children.  She is a housewife and has worked in agriculture for 20 years growing pineapples.  Her parents taught her this work as it is her family's trade.  She attended school through the 6th grade, and thanks God for the support her parents provided, both morally and financially.    Her children are adolescents.  Three of the 4 live with her and help her with the different activities in the fields such as weeding, fertilizing, and applying fungicides, etc.  Her customers are travelers who take the CA-5 from north to south and east to west, as this is the main road in the country.  She has many dreams for her family and for her crops.  For her family, she hopes for prosperity for her children and the ability to support each one of them with their education and goals.  She hopes to provide resources that increase their household income or allow them to build houses.  For her crops, she would like to expand to yucca and coffee.  In the future she would also like to fix up her house, which needs repairs. Today she is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies to care for her pineapple crop in order to have an excellent production this season.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to care for her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат молодая и умная женщина. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Саёхат более 5 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Теперь она хочет организовать новый бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она хочет открыть свой швейный цех. Саёхат участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 850 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sayohat is an intelligent young woman who is single and lives with her parents.  Although she has been involved in agriculture for more than five years, she now wants to start her own business.  She would like to open her own sewing shop and sew women's clothes.  She received a certificate after completing a course entitled "Achieving Success", organized by the Association of Business Women.  She is taking a loan of 850 somoni to buy a sewing machine.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and start her new business.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en: Sokny is 39 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been employed at a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband sells fish. He makes an income of $7 daily. One of her children is also a garment worker who makes an income of $4 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sokny is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Merry Mhae

texts.en: Merry Mhae is a single entrepreneur who manages a service-based business providing transportation and rickshaw rental. Merry Mhae has been engaged in her business for more than three years and she earns well enough that she was able to support her parents and saved money from additional capital of the business.
