Saroeum, a second-time borrower, forms a group of two with a first-time borrower in order to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) again. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to uplift her livelihood at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she is applying for 1,000,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is seeking 200,000 KHR. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that she can make a good yield, better than last year, and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ricardo Adolfo

texts.es: Don ricardo de 48 años de edad se dedica a la reparación de bicicletas desde hace varios años, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su esposa ella se dedica  ala crianza de pollos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposa logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don ricardo esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para bicicletas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposa.
texts.en: Ricardo is 48 years old. He has been repairing bicycles for several years. His workshop is located in his house. He lives in his own house with his wife. She raises chickens. With what he obtains from his work and with the help from his wife, they are able to meet some of the expenses of their household. Ricardo is requesting the loan to buy replacement parts for bicycles because this is his only source of work and it will allow him to have better earnings and to have a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Victor ha trabajado la tierra desde muy joven gracias al apoyo de sus padres que le han dejado como herencia el amor a la agricultura misma que hoy en dia ha hecho que el pueda prosperar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, casado, padre de hijos ya mayores que le ayudan con el trabajo. el credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos agricolas como. completo, urea, triple, etc. asi su cosecha de Piyahaya esta optima para que pueda floreser y dar buenos frutos, ademas evitar la propagacion de plagas en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Víctor has worked the land from a very young age, thanks to the support of his parents, who gave him a love of farming as a legacy.  This has allowed him to prosper and improve his living conditions today.  He's married and the father of adult children who help him with the work.

Víctor's requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as urea and Completo and Triple fertilizers.  This way his dragon fruit harvest will be ideal for flourishing and giving good products.  He'll also avoid the propagation of pests on his plants.

loans.use: to take care of his crop

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi, 30 years of age, is married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost one year and earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her profits are usually spent on school fees and daily expenditures. Due to lack of capital for her retail store, she would like to request a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase beverages, dried fish, and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, dried fish, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a 50-year-old widow with one child and she works very hard to provide for her child.

Genara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, snack foods, noodles, sugar, toothpaste, etc. 

Genara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general stor.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is aged 32 years, married, and has one child. Being a responsible father, he aims to become financially stable in order to satisfy the necessities of his family. To generate additional income, he operates his motorcycle transport within his community. 

To continuously maintain his motorcycle in good condition, he is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy wheels, spare parts, and accessories needed for his motorcycle. He believes that this financial assistance will enable him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy wheels, spare parts, and accessories needed for his motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: A local citizen from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Savy is 31 years old and a single lady who strives to make a living via rice farming and planting mango. It is the business that she has had for more than 10 years. Having never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Savy is seeking her first microloan to buy potash, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop and use a small portion to buy more grocery items for resale as additional income. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her existing and new business.

loans.use: to buy potash, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop and to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Elisabeth Newu

texts.en:
Elisabeth Newu is married and a mother of four children. They live in a two-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life (sickness, the death of her mother and two brothers, thieves breaking into her house, and financial difficulties starting up a business, to mention a few). 

With this new loan requested, she will invest in buying groundnuts, vegetables, fertilizer, and seedlings such as corn and beans. She will also farm cassava and Irish potatoes. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and has regular customers who buy from her and also because the demand for foodstuffs is always high. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling prices, providing food for a rapid increasing population.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs, ensure her children's education, provide food for the family and save in order to meet emergency needs. She prefers loans from GHAPE (Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment) because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals and also because the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Also, members' social needs are catered to at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, vegetables, and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 58-year-old married  man.  Salim   is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables from his place in a central bazaar and from his home. He has 13 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers because he was a merchant in a food market.

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings a stable income. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and they also make fresh punch. His monthly income is 120 AZN. 

Now  Salim wants to repair his market but he has not enough funds. For that, he wants to take a loan of 1,000 AZN .This is going to be his first loan.

loans.use: to repair his market

loans.name: Fassoun

texts.fr:
Monsieur  FASSOUN  est âgé de 47 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et son épouse dans le village de FARABA sous préfecture de KOUROUBA, Région de Koulikoro.
FASSOUN n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales, et des articles divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant d’articles divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son quatrième prêt  qui servira à acheter des articles divers : produits alimentaires, de beauté et des jouets  auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à FARABA et village environnant  à crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
FASSOUN espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 120.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fassoun is 47 years old, and lives with his wife and five children in the village of Faraba.  Faraba is in the sub-prefecture of Kourouba, in the Koulikoro region.

Fassoun didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  He started working at a young age in the purchase and sale of cereals and various other items.  He learnt his trade from his maternal uncle, who used to be a big trader of various items.

In order to satisfy the needs of his customers, Fassoun began working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be his fourth loan with this field partner.  He will use his loan to buy various items (food products, beauty products and toys) from wholesalers in Bamako.  Fassoun will then resell these products in the area around Faraba.  He sells to many customers, on a cash or credit basis.

Fassoun hopes to earn a monthly average of 120,000 francs CFA, he will use his earnings to repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 42 years old and lives in the village of Mukhiani. He is single and lives with his retired parents. Paata grows greens on his own piece of land and sells the harvest at the local open market periodically. In addition, he breeds two milk cows and takes good care of his livestock. His income from agriculture is seasonal and modest, so the family lives in poverty. 

Paata decided to apply for this loan and start his greenhouse business. He is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering him, since thanks to their help he will be able to purchase all the needed materials for his greenhouse construction. He plans to grow various greens in wintertime and plant tomatoes and cucumbers in summer. He will sell his harvest the whole year and generate income. Thanks to this loan, he will improve their quality of life and increase the family funds. Paata awaits your support.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: A 49-year-old mother of five children originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Chantha is a local farmer who grow edible arum as her main source of income. Besides this agribusiness, she also tailors clothes in her local area to earn additional income. The business that she has had for 20 years earns her about 39,000 KHR per day. Including this loan, Chantha is a third-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans completely and the loans have improved her living conditions as well as kept her kids in school. Now, she leads a huge group of six borrowers to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and four other borrowers are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, while the remaining borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy good arum seedling for replanting and to buy potash to boost its yield. She hopes that she can make more income from this business so that she can renovate her house and keep her kids in school until tertiary (university) level.

loans.use: To buy good arum seedlings and potash

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her children.

She operates a vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing her business in the future. 

With the KES loan 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, 30, is a mother of one little child living in Siem Reap province. For her family, rice farming on four hectares of farmland is the single source of income which has generated her about 18,000 KHR in order to support the daily cost of living. 

Neang, who has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for past three cycles and has fully repaid back the loans already, has formed a group of two to get a new loan.  She is applying for 1,200,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is seeking for 200,000 KHR. As the leader, Neang will spend her entire loan portion to pay the fee for workers to harvest her crops. She hopes to collect her yield on time so that she can sell with a good price with a good profit in return.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fee to workers

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1965, FATOUMATA vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux à MANA dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
FATOUMATA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce de céréales et d’articles divers. FATOUMATA, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales et de produits alimentaires : arachide, niébé, mil, fonio, maïs, dah, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les 4 prêts précédents, FATOUMATA est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  50 sacs de mil, auprès des paysans producteurs (à OUELESSEBOUGOU, MANA et MORIDJAMBOUGOU) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
FATOUMATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fatoumata was born around 1965, and lives with her husband and their seven children, in a nuclear family.  They live in the rural area of Ouelessebougou.

Fatoumata began working at a young age, with her aunt who bought and sold cereals and other products.  After building up several years of experience with her aunt, Fatoumata decided to buy and sell cereals and other food products (peanuts, black-eyed peas, millet, fonio, maize, hibiscus flower, etc).

This will be her fifth loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  Her previous four loans were all correctly repaid on time.  Fatoumata will use her loan to buy fifty sacks of millet from farmer-producers (in Ouelessebougou, Mana or Moridjambougou) or, occasionally, from local wholesalers.  She sells her product on a cash or credit basis, from her home, at the market in Ouelessebougou or at local fairs.  Most of her sales are directly to consumers.

Fatoumata hopes to earn 50,000 francs CFA a month, and she will use her earnings to help her husband with the expenses of their family, to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en: Enkhbat, 43 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a hairdresser at a barbershop since 2010. Her husband stopped rendering taxi service due to a car breakdown. Using her previous loan, she purchased an electric car for her son. Now she is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to buy an electric car for her husband. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. Her husband is a very hardworking individual and will use the car for taxi service because he can't sit idle without working.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice used her previous loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. It was profitable and she repaid the loan successfully. Besides farming, she also has a mobile money transfer business which she has been running for the past year and she makes a monthly income of KES 9,500. 

She plans to use the loan to add more money float to the mobile money transfer business. She will also buy more stock of mobile phone accessories such as chargers, batteries, cables, phone covers and earphones. She will use the generated profits to educate her children.

Her future hopes are to build rental houses as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To add money float and phone accessories.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 49 years old and he lives in Sevan city which is in Gegharkunik region. Arsen is married and he lives with his wife, his son and his daughter. Arsen’s son is on military services in the army and his daughter works at a food market as a salesgirl. Arsen has two higher educations and a specialty of pedagogic and is also an inspector of baby foods. 

Several years Arsen worked at a bread factory as a leading specialist and now he works at a private company as a technologist. Arsen is very good father and beloved husband in his family and provides for his family perfectly. For many years Arsen has a great desire to buy a car, but he has not enough money for such a purchase. 

He asks for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a car, which will make his great wish come true after so many years.

loans.use: to buy a car to make his great wish come true

loans.name: Saveung's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Saveung is 31 years old and a mother blessed with three children who are currently in school. To earn a living, she grows rice and cassava with support from her husband who also spends his time in catching fish for resale to supplement the family’s income. 

Now, Saveung and her joint borrower, who have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) at least four cycles, have fully repaid their past loan already. Now, she is a leader of this group. Savoeung will spend her entire portion to pay the plowing fee and labor costs and to buy fertilizer for her crop. She highly believes that she gain get more income from her business so as she can improve her living at a gradual pace.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and labor costs and to buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Sanani

texts.en:
Sanani is a 55 year-old married man with three children. He has bred livestock from a very young age thanks to his father who taught him well. He already has 10 years of experience. During these years, Sanani has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. He purchases calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profitable price in a livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.

His business requires a lot of physical strength, as Sanani spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals. His monthly income is 150 AZN and Sanani wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put into his business and cover the market. For this purpose, he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will use the loan to buy two cattle, one milkier cow and fodder. This will be his first loan

loans.use: to buy cattle, one milkier cow and fodder

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 33-year-old married man.  He is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods including macaroni, butter, and candies. He has 8 years of experience and has extensive knowledge of the market and the demands of his clients.

Murad sells food products that are very popular and are in high demand. His monthly profit selling foods is 200 AZN. His brother helps him to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for his family. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good business location which is in the central bazaar of his home city.

He applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover his customers` demands.

loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is smart woman. She was born in 1963 in a working family. She was one of the best pupils in a school. After graduating from school, she entered the Pedagogical University. Since 1987, she has worked in a school. She teaches geography. Mavluda is a married parent of three children. Her children are adults. Her husband is a businessman. Mavluda and her husband made repairs to their house. Now, they want to buy furniture but they have no money. Mavluda is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy furniture. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widowed woman who has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children as she is the breadwinner in the family. 

She has been operating a fish selling business for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old enthusiastic man living with his retired mother and grandmother. David is an auto mechanic and is employed at the local auto repair shop in return for a monthly salary. His earnings are very small and unstable, so the family lives in poverty and gets small-sized social assistance from the local government. 

That's why he decided to start his own business. With this start-up credit, David will construct a building and purchase all the equipment needed to set up an auto repair shop there. He will work as a mechanic and serve the local drivers in return for a fee. David hopes that his business initiative will be lucrative as he has rich experience in that field and he will make his family members' lives easier.

loans.use: to start an auto repair shop

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mon is a 45-year-old woman and a citizen from Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is one of the breadwinners in the family which consists of two children. Rice farming enables her to deal with the basic needs in her household.  Mon also has a paid-working job during her spare time. 

She earns about 21,000 KHR per day from these businesses. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Mon and her fellow group member are requesting 1,200,000 KHR each.  They are second-time borrowers and have fully repaid their past loan. As a leader, Mon will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop and to pump water for her rice field. She hopes that she can make double income to expand her business generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop and to pump water for her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang is a local farmer residing in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 34 years old and has three dependent children. During his free time, her husband also helps to earn more income via catching fish for resale. 

The farming business has generated Sreyneang about 18,800 KHR per day. This is the second microloan for her group, consisting of three female borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For Sreyneang, the positive impact of her past loan, which she has repaid, has been to uplift her lifestyle better than before. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pump water for her crop and to buy a decent motorbike to shipping vegetable for resale. She hopes that she can earn more income via her crop so that she can expand her business in a larger scale.

loans.use: to pump water for her crop and buy a motorbike for transporting crops to market

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: İxtiyar

texts.en: İxtiyar is single and lives with his parents in Baku region. His father has been sick for 3 years and Ixtiyar's mother takes care of him. Ixtiyar's parents do not work (earn an income) and Ixtiyar provides for his family. He builds the foundations of houses. He requests a loan of 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to buy construction materials including fixtures and wire. Ixtiyar is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for their help. In the future, he wants to get married and have children. He also wants to hire an assistant in the future to help with his work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir is married and the father of three children. They live in the Baku region. His wife is a housewife and doesn’t work in business. One of his children is 13 years old and goes to the sixth grade class, another is 10 years old and goes to the fourth grade class,  and the smallest is 8 years old and goes to the second grade class of school. 

Zakir has been a taxi driver for three years. Zakir adores his family and to support them, he works hard. Today he needs a loan of 900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his car’s interior. Therefore he has applied to the Komak company for a loan. Zakir is thankful to  the Komak company, Kiva organization, and lenders for help. In the future he wants to change the wheels of his car.

loans.use: to repair his car’s interior for use as a taxi

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old married father of three children.  He has been working in the sanitary and tiles business since May 2011.
Ali is a hard worker who has developed his business to make sure that he can respond to his family and customer needs.
Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his merchandise with current items and tools for the special sanitary and tiles business. 
Ali hopes to expand his business and start working in the wholesale trade and be capable of covering most construction projects in nearby villages.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with current items and tools for the special sanitary and tiles business.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda is 25 years old and a local villager from Kandal province.  She earns a living as a local school teacher. This occupation generates around 8.50 USD per day.  With this income, she supports the daily needs of her family.  Chenda is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking this loan to pay for the tuition fee for her husband who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree specializing in Law. She hopes that her husband can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and a mother of four children. They all live in a three bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced some challenges in life, a few to mention are the sickness and loss of her pigs and poverty to start up a business.

With this new loan she has requested, she will invest in buying sewing materials, fertilizer and farm seedling.  She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and furthermore, she has been trained on sewing and farm work. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate price selling, providing food and clothing for a rapidly increasing population.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family's needs; ensure her children's education and; provide food for the family. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.  Also social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy material, fertilizer and farm seedlings.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarrina was born in 1979. She is a smart and kind woman. She has a higher education and is a teacher in a school. She teaches biology. Zarrina has worked in this field for more than 3 years. She has 3 children. Zarrina has always wanted to make a living. She has a small salary which is why she has not had the opportunity to buy jewellery for her children. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy jewellery for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy jewellery for her children.

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.en: Mukimjon is a young and hardworking man. He is 22 years old. Mukimjon is not married and lives with his parents. He was in the army for 2 years. Recently he came back. Now, he must earn a living as his parents are pensioners. Mukimjon is a master of repairing houses. He knows his craft well. For the winter season there are fewer repairs required which is why Mukimjon wants to organize an additional business of a taxi service. He does not own a car. Mukimjon is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a car for organizing his new business.

loans.name: Abed Al Wahid

texts.en:
Abed Al Wahid is a 59-year-old married father of three children who has been selling fruit juices and cocktails since May 2013, to make his living and cover his family's expenses.

Abed Al Wahid is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special desserts that will attract new customers and will increase his income, especially during the coming Holy christmas celebrations where people seek such tasty things.
Abed Al Wahid hopes to keep on developing his business through diversifying his products and expanding his working zone.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special desserts in addition to fruit juices and cocktails.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the region of Hoima in Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past five years, Rogers has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells beer, wine, spirits and soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, Rogers has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer, sodas, spirits, and water, and will help Rogers to generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs. Rogers hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Rogers is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rogers who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beer, sodas, spirits, and water.

loans.name: Nanyanga's Group

texts.en:
Bakholera Alala is a group of 6 group leader farmers in the Busia District with Nanyanga selected as the Kiva representative.  Nanyanga has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 50 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Nanyanga is 43 years old and has been a farmer for 20years.  Nanyanga works as a farmer to provide for her 7 children.  The community and other farmers know Nanyanga as friendly, hardworking, reliable and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community activities such as the women's group, prayer group and the burial committee.  Nanyanga described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
							
Nanyanga first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Nanyanga joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Nanyanga plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Nanyanga’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and is able to save money and feed the family.  							
Nanyanga and the Bakholera Alala Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Blanca de 44 años de edad, vive con sus dos  02 hijos que dependen de ella en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace muchos años  a la venta de abarrotería como ser: café, huevos, granos básicos, carnes, frescos, ropa, etc.
Doña Blanca  es una mujer bien trabajadora con muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para de azúcar, café, pan, manteca, arroz, frijoles, agua, leche, etc. y tener más productos para su negocio ya que desea surtirlo porque la demanda es bastante fuerte para esta época. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es tener una buena pulpería bien surtida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Blanca is 44 years old and lives with her two dependent children in a San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.  She has a home of her own and has been selling groceries, such as coffee, eggs, basic grains, meats, soft drinks, clothing, etc. for several years.

Blanca is a hardworking woman with many desires to get her family ahead.  She is asking for this loan to buy sugar, coffee, bread, lard, rice, beans, water, milk, etc. and have more products for her business because the demand is high during this season.

She hopes to improve her business and quality of life with the help of this loan.

Her dream is to have a well-stocked store.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – December 2013.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Yasmina Del Socorro

texts.es: Yasmina es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. De oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado comprar productos de alto consumo y mantener a los clientes satisfechos. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar productos tales como: Arroz, Azúcar, Sardinas, Gaseosas entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ir  mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Yasmina is from Granada and has a store.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because she was able to buy high consumable products and keep her customers satisfied.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, sardines, soft drinks, and other things.  She believes that this loan will be of great help so she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Keneddy

texts.en:
Keneddy is 47 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the region of Hoima in Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Keneddy has been working hard to manage his boutique shop where he sells skirts, blouses and trousers. 

To help expand his business, Keneddy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new skirts, blouses and trousers for sale, and will help Keneddy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Keneddy hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more plots of land. 

Keneddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Keneddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more new skirts, blouses and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 23-year-old single man, who has been working selling silver since six years ago. In May 2013, he established his current business to develop his living and increase his income.

Bilal is well-known in his region. With his good reputation and special talent in his business, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with new released silver accessories which will diversify his products and attract the attention of customers, especially before the coming Christmas season where people start looking for special gifts for beloved ones.

Bilal is looking forward to keep on developing and improving his business in a well-managed way to be capable in the future of opening another branch or starting wholesale trade if possible.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with new released silver accessories which will diversify his products and attract the attention of customers, especially before the coming Christmas season where people start looking for special gifts for beloved ones.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Lukhuna Group is a group of 7 farmers in the Kakamega North District with Joseph selected as the Kiva representative.  Joseph has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 70 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Joseph is 45 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years.  Joseph works as a farmer to provide for his 10 children.  The community and other farmers know Joseph as hardworking and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as the men's group and savings group.  Joseph described his harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
							
Joseph first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Joseph joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers.  Joseph plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, and repair the home, and buy a cow, and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  
  							
Joseph and the Lukhuna Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
ISSA  est âgé de 49 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et ses époux dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
ISSA   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le deuxième prêt il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales (maïs, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONAN et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
ISSA  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Issa is 49 years old and lives with his 5 children and wives in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, in the Koulikoro region. Issa did not have the opportunity to go to school. He became interested in revenue-generating activities at a young age, notably the buying, storing and sale of cereals. He learned this trade from his maternal uncle, who was, in those days, a big cereal reseller.

Issa decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy his growing clientèle. Having already repaid his second loan, he is now on his third individual loan which will be used to buy 3 tonnes of cereals (corn, millet, fonio) from the farmers in Dongoronan and the surrounding area. The cereal will be stored for at least 3 months. He sells mainly wholesale to a clientèle made up of resellers from the large towns like Bamako in Ouelessebougou. Issa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80 000 francs, which will be used to repay the loan, and then the rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha appreciates the previous loan which helped her to buy potatoes for sale.  Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy variety of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes for sale. She appreciates for the support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr:
Monsieur  LASSINE  est âgé de 46 ans et vit avec ses huit enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à DONGORONA, un des villages de la sous préfecture  de Ouelessebougou,  Région de Koulikoro.
LASSINE n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son quatrième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, mil, fonio) et de haricot, auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONA et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
LASSINE espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Lassine is 46 years old and lives with his 8 children and wife in a traditional family in Dongorona, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, in the Koulikoro region. Lassine did not have the opportunity to go to school. He became interested in revenue-generating activities at a young age, notably the buying, storing and sale of cereals. He learned this trade from his maternal uncle, who was, back then, a big cereal reseller.

Lassine decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy his growing clientèle. Having repaid his third loan, he is now on his fourth individual loan which will be used to buy 4 tonnes of cereals (corn, millet, fonio) and beans from the farmers in Dongoronan and the surrounding area. The cereal will be stored for at least 3 months. He sells mainly wholesale to a clientèle made up of resellers from large towns like Bamako. Lassine hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan, and part of which will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and beans.

loans.name: Nianankoro

texts.fr:
NIANANCORO  est âgé de 59 ans et vit avec ses sept enfants et son époux dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
NIANANCORO  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs,  mil, fonio) et de haricot auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONA et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
NIANANCORO espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Nianancoro is 59 years old and lives with his 7 children and wife in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, in the Koulikoro region. Nianancoro did not have the opportunity to get an education. He became interested in revenue-generating activities at a young age, notably the buying, storage and sale of cereals. He learned this trade from his maternal uncle, who was, back then, a large cereal reseller.

Nianancoro decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy his growing clientèle. Having repaid his third loan, he is now on his fourth individual loan which will be used to buy 4 tonnes of cereals (corn, millet, fonio) and beans from the farmers in Dongoronan and the surrounding area. The cereal will be stored for at least 3 months. He sells mainly wholesale to a clientèle made up of resellers coming from large towns like Bamako, in Ouelessebougou. Nianancoro hopes to make an average monthly profit of 85 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan, and part of which will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and beans.

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es: Nora de 41 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar junto con su madre y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras desde 10 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Nora esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor y continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Nora is 41 years old. She lives in a relative's house with her mother and two children. She has sold fruit and vegetables for 10 years. She has her business in the market that is located near her residence. She has a lot of customers because of the quality of the produce and the good prices. With what she obtains from her business she is able to pay for the household expenses. Nora is asking for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale and continue with her work. It is her only source of income and this way she can give her family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Daysi Beatriz

texts.es: Daysi de 30 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Daysi is 30 years old. She lives in a relative's house with her husband and two children. She has a store where she sells staple products such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and more. She has had her business for many years and this has given her experience in sales, which allows her to obtain the best profit. It is located in her residence and it is very well known by the neighborhood residents. She has earned a lot of customers because her store is well stocked. She wants to grow her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital. That is why she has asked for a loan to buy what she needs for her store. She is sure she can pay off the debt and she is also confident it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, coffee, sugar, snacks, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a final course to get her degree.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
Raymundo es  productor de leche  con la cual elabora quesos y los vende en las ferias de la población de Achacachi,  recientemente falleció su esposa razón por la cual vive junto a su sobrina la cual le ayuda en el cuidado del ganado; ellos viven  en la comunidad de Cotapampa  de la provincia Omasuyos ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz  donde tiene su casa propia. 

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de alimento suplementario y así  mejorar la alimentación y nutrición del ganado lechero se optimizara la productividad lechera y directamente se incrementa los ingresos de las familias. Con la compra de alimentos suplementarios se mitiga en la presión de ampliar más áreas de producción de forrajes, liberando así a la tierra para que descanse sin poner en riesgo el medio ambiente. Así mismo existe un déficit de proteína cruda en los forrajes de cebada y son necesarios en los épocas de estiaje (meses junio a noviembre), por lo tanto en estas épocas críticas se mejora la nutrición del ganado lechero, utilizando suplementos como harina de maíz, cascarilla de soya, afrecho y otros.   

El sueño de Raymundo es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Raymundo produces milk to make cheese that he sells in the markets in the town of Achacachi.  His wife recently died, so he's living with his niece, who helps him take care of the cows.  They live in the community of Cotapampa in the province of Omasuyos, located three hours from the city of La Paz.  He has his own house.

Raymundo needs the loan to buy supplementary feed to improve the feeding and nutrition of his dairy cows.  This will optimize his milk production and directly increase the family income.

The purchase of supplementary feed will reduce the pressure to increase more areas of fodder production, freeing the land to rest without putting the environment at risk.  There's also a deficit of protein in the barley fodder, but it's necessary from June through November, the low-water months.  So in these critical periods he has to improve the nutrition of his dairy cows by using corn flour, soy chaff, bran, and other supplements.

Raymundo's dream is to have more cattle.

This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplementary feed

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a member of Mkulima Group in Chwele District. She is pictured here, standing on the right with her hand raised, with two other One Acre Fund group-leader farmers. The field officer, also included in the photo, is standing on the left. These group leaders represent 43 individual One Acre Fund farmer, who are not pictured here.
							
Jackline, 32, has been a farmer for 20 years. She works to provide for her four children. The community and other farmers know her as hardworking and trustworthy and as an experienced farmer. Other than farming, she is involved in community activities such as the women's group and the prayer group. As an active community member, she has also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative. 

Jackline describes her harvest last year as good but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group. She joined One Acre Fund because she wants to be rich in farming. She has been selected as the Kiva group representative. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving a quarter acre of maize and a quarter acre of sorghum or millet, which is an average input loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.						

Jackline first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. She has joined this season to get the best seed prices and to earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for farmers.  Her own life has improved because she has more profits from her harvests and has been able to save money and feed her family too. 
 							
Jackline and the Mkulima Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. The organization will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments on their loan. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To access hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell from her stall.

Isabel has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from a general store business. Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell from her stall

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married with four school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwaka has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from her home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future. With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dried bush meat for her business.

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa is a married man with five school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past eight years, he has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He mentioned price fluctuation as his major challenge. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. He decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Josielie

texts.en:
Josielie earns an income by operating a general store business. She has been engaged in this enterprise for the past five years. Though unmarried, she works hard to help support her extended family.

Josielie has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 loan through NWTF. She intends to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

In the future, Josielie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory items for her general store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 41 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Judith has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood stock to sell. Judith has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood stock to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Judith works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Judith is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for her bicycle transport business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for her business

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Doña Dora de 57 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Dora vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 25 años, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio. la clienta solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, peñas, tomates, cebollas, etc. ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia
texts.en: Dora is 57 years old and very hard-working.  She dedicates herself fully to her business, all in order to get ahead and provide her family with a better life. Dora lives with her partner and son, in the house that they own.  She has had a fruit and vegetable stall at a local market for 25 years.  Dora's husband helps with the business.  Dora is applying for a loan to buy papaya, bananas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and more.  With these products she can sell more, which is her priority, and then give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy papaya, bananas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and more.

loans.name: Dora Sandra

texts.es: Doña dora se dedica  a la venta de zapatos desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su hijo de 21 años de edad, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Dora esta solicitando un préstamo par ala compra de zapatos por mayor y tambien para la compra de ropa y asi poder surtir su negocio con mas productos para obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hijo.
texts.en: Dora has been making a living selling shoes for a number of years.  She runs the business, with her 21-year-old son, out of her home, which she owns. With her earnings, Dora is able to cover some household costs. Dora is applying for a loan in order to buy shoes in bulk and also to buy clothes and thus stock up her business with more profits. She will then have higher profits and a higher quality of life with her son.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Jenny Maribel

texts.es: Jenny de 35 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con sus tres hijos, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza desde hace 12 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Jenny solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Thirty-five-year-old Jenny is a single mother.  She lives in a rented house with her three children.  Jenny has had a beauty salon in her home for 12 years.  There she works from 9am until 7pm.  She works well and so has many customers and, with her profits, she is able to cover the household costs. Jenny is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon.  She will buy creams, shampoos, hairpins, scissors, and more items which she needs.  She can then earn better profits, helping her to have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoos, hairpins, scissors, and more.

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es: Leonel vive junto a su compañera de vida  y sus  hijos, él se dedica a la venta de tostadas de yuca, papa, y plátano,lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias donde el reside, adicional a eso también se dedica  al cultivo de maiz, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar plátanos, yuca, papa, bolsas, etc. Leonel tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Leonel lives with his partner and two children.  He makes a living selling loads of yucca, potatoes, and plantains as a street vendor in the different areas around where he lives. In addition Leonel wors growing corn.  With the earnings he makes from his work, Leonel is able to cover some household. Leonel now needs another loan and so is applying for "INTEGRAL". This loan will allow Leonel to buy plantains, yucca, potatoes, bags, and more.  Leonel has a good credit rating and is confident that he can pay off the debt and, at the same time, he is sure that he can give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy plantains, yucca, potatoes, bags, and more.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 23 years old and has a live-in partner. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Jenny has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Jenny has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like pork, chicken, hot dogs, seasonings, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 3 years now and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like pork, chicken, hot dogs, seasonings, etc. for her business

loans.name: Pedro Adolfo

texts.es:
Pedro, solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de tomates, repollo, chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, bebidas, etc., lo que le servirá para surtir el inventario de su pupuseria y de esa forma continuar trabajando.
Con el préstamo anterior surtió  de materia prima la pupuseria lo que le ayudo a mejorar la atención  hacia los clientes, dándole como resultado una  clientela fiel, sus ventas han aumentado y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Pedro is asking for a new loan so he can buy tomatoes, cabbage, fried pork rinds, cottage cheese, corn, drinks, etc. which will help him stock his store and allow him to continue with his work.

He used the previous loan to buy supplies for his pupusa restaurant, which helped him improve his customer service and gave him loyal customers, increased sales and his family circumstances improved.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, and more.

loans.name: Vilma Aida

texts.es: Vilma de 49 años de edad vive en asa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de paletas, desde hace 1 año, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela pues es un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Vilma esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de paletas por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancais para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vilma is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  Vilma has been making a living selling ice lollies for a year.  She runs the business out of her home and has many customers as her products is very popular.  With her profits, and help from her husband, the couple is able to cover some household costs. Vilma is applying for a loan in order to buy ice lollies in bulk and thus earn better profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ice lollies in bulk.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long, age 41, earns an income by selling phone cards and phone accessories in front of her house. She has been engaged in this business for the past 10 years. She and her husband, who works as a driver for hire, live in Ho Chi Minh City with their two daughters.

Long is requesting a loan because she wants to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of phone cards and a greater variety of phone accessories to stock in her store. Her objective is to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes that her business will run smoothly and that it will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cell phone cards and accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Group Assacau

texts.en:
Agustinha is one the members of the Assacau Group, pictured here. "Assacau" means "hope" in the members' local language.
 
Agustinha describes herself as a hard-working woman. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital of USD $100.

She is requesting a loan so that she can add to her capital, which will allow her to buy essential supplies such as firewood.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con sus padres, él posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que el realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; él es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesto, El cliente esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi el  puede tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus padres.
texts.en:
This client lives in his own house with his parents. He runs a sewing shop from his home where he makes different kinds of garments. Lately, he has had many customers because the work that he does is excellent. He sells his products at competitive prices. He is very dedicated to his work and is an honest and responsible man. 

This client is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy fabrics, thread, needles and everything else he needs for sewing so that he can continue to meet the needs of his customers. In this way, he can have a better quality of life together with his parents.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is a hard-working woman who strives hard to better her living standards. The previous loan helped her to boost her business, and she bought a variety of grains for sale. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy maize grains, beans, wheat and rice for sale to add to the stock in her business. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy maize grains, beans, wheat and rice for sale

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: el cliente vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, desde hace varios años se dedica  a la venta de medicina natural, lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a buenos precios, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina por mayor y seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su compañera de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in his own house with his life partner.  For the past few years he has been selling natural medicines, going from market-to-market in the areas near where he lives. He has many customers because he sells high quality products at good prices.  He is asking for a loan to buy more medicines at wholesale so he can continue with his work, which is his only source of income, and to have a better quality of life together with his life partner.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines at wholesale.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with eight children.  Leonila is 46 years old and has three children who are still in school.
 
She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonila has a buy and sell frozen food business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for five years.

Leonila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Leonila requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

Leonila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of bicycle for her business

loans.name: Joel Alberto

texts.es: Joel es a sus 21 años, es un humilde joven muy esforzado que lucha por un futuro mejor, actualmente  labora como docente en una escuela en el área de computación devengando un salario mínimo, con sus ingresos pagaba su carrera universitaria, Ing. en sistemas, del cual ahora es egresado. Solicita este apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación que aún le queda pendiente por realizar, lo que le permitirá optar a un empleo mejor remunerado e ir adquiriendo más experiencia de la que tiene hoy en día.
texts.en: Joel is 21 years old and is a humble, very hard-working young man who is fighting to have a better future. Currently he works as a school teacher in the field of computers, earning a minimal salary. His income paid for his university studies in Systems Engineering, which he has now completed. His last step is to take a professional title course, and he is asking for this loan to pay for it. Having his professional title will allow him to have a better paid job and to continue to acquire more experience than he now has.

loans.use: to pay for his professional title course.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 57 years old and married with three children.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Leonora has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Leonora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is married, and has four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 5,000, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Emily operated a food making business, making staples like beans and chapatti (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbours. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. 

She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is a member of Bidii Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 56 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  David has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.
							
David is married and has 4 children.  He is 34 years old and is known as trustworthy.  He is active in his community in groups such as the Men's Group and Burial Committee.  David has been a farmer for 12 years.  David described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 
 							
David first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  David joined One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and wants to help more farmers.  David plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to buy a goat.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  David’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and feed the family.
 
David and the Bidii Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
	
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.
